original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽have the perception of things,

original: dngos po'i 'du shes sam /🔽dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes sam / dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of nonthings,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes nas rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes kyi bar ram /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes nas rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes kyi bar ram /
translated: or the perception of form up to the perception of consciousness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'dod chags kyi 'du shes sam; 'dod chags spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'du shes sam; 'dod chags spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of desire, or the perception of the abandonment of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of anger,

original: zhe sdang spong ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽gti mug gi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: zhe sdang spong ba'i 'du shes sam / gti mug gi 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of the abandonment of anger,

original: gti mug spong ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽ma rig pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: gti mug spong ba'i 'du shes sam / ma rig pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of delusion, or the perception of the abandonment of delusion,

original: ma rig pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽'du byed kyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: ma rig pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam / 'du byed kyi 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of ignorance, or the perception of the abandonment of ignorance,

original: 'du byed spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du byed spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of volitional factors, or the perception of the abandonment of volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of consciousness,🔽or the perception of the eyes, or the perception of the abandonment of the eyes,🔽or the perception of the ears, or the perception of the abandonment of the ears,🔽or the perception of the nose, or the perception of the abandonment of the nose,🔽or the perception of the tongue, or the perception of the abandonment of the tongue,🔽or the perception of the body, or the perception of the abandonment of the body,🔽or the perception of the mental faculty, or the perception of the abandonment of the mental faculty,🔽or the perception of sights, or the perception of the abandonment of sights,🔽or the perception of sounds, or the perception of the abandonment of sounds,🔽or the perception of smells, or the perception of the abandonment of smells,🔽or the perception of tastes, or the perception of the abandonment of tastes,🔽or the perception of tangibles, or the perception of the abandonment of tangibles,🔽or the perception of mental phenomena, or the perception of the abandonment of mental phenomena,🔽or the perception of eye consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of eye consciousness,🔽or the perception of ear consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of ear consciousness,🔽or the perception of nose consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of nose consciousness,🔽or the perception of tongue consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of tongue consciousness,🔽or the perception of body consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of body consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa spong @59b ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa spong @59b ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the perception of thinking consciousness, or the perception of the abandonment of thinking consciousness,🔽or the perception of eye contact, or the perception of the abandonment of eye contact,🔽or the perception of ear contact, or the perception of the abandonment of ear contact,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of name and form,

original: ming dang gzugs spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning name and form,

original: skye mched drug gi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the six sense sources,

original: skye mched drug spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: skye mched drug spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning the six sense sources,

original: reg pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of contact,

original: reg pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: reg pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning contact,

original: tshor ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of feeling,

original: tshor ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning feeling,

original: sred pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: sred pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of craving,

original: sred pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: sred pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning craving,

original: len pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: len pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of appropriation,

original: len pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: len pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning appropriation,

original: srid pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of becoming,

original: srid pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: srid pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning becoming,

original: skye ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: skye ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of birth,

original: skye ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: skye ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning birth,

original: rga shi'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: rga shi'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of old age and death,

original: rga shi spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: rga shi spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of abandoning old age and death,🔽the perception of sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and disturbance,

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of sorrow,🔽lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation,

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa spong ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the abandonment of sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and turmoil,

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes sam /🔽sdug bsngal spong ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽kun 'byung ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes sam / sdug bsngal spong ba'i 'du shes sam / kun 'byung ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of suffering,🔽the perception of the abandonment of suffering,🔽the perception of the arising of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam /🔽'gog pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spong ba'i 'du shes sam / 'gog pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the abandonment of the arising of suffering,🔽the perception of the cessation of suffering,

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bgyid pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bgyid pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the realization of the cessation of suffering,

original: lam gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: lam gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the path,

original: lam bsgom pa'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of the cultivation of the path,

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'du shes sam /
translated: and similarly, up to the perception of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ba'i 'du shes mchis lags sam /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ba'i 'du shes mchis lags sam /
translated: or the perception of the abandonment of the latent afflictions?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab @60a *// 'byor /
analyzed: rab @60a *// 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni chos gang la'ang dngos po'i 'du shes sam; dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni chos gang la'ang dngos po'i 'du shes sam; dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, does he have a notion of an entity or a non-entity in regard to any dharma?🔽The Lord : No, Subhuti.

original: rab 'byor / gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i bzod pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti : What then is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, conformity with the Dharma?🔽The Lord : When he has no notion of an entity or a non-entity.

original: gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni de'i lam bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni de'i lam bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti : What then is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, cultivation of the path?🔽The Lord : When he has no notion of an entity or a non-entity.🔽Subhuti : What then is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, fruit of a saint?

original: gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang la dngos po'i 'du shes med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyang med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The Lord : When he has no notion of an entity or a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Subhuti : What then is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, path?

original: mngon par rtogs pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The Lord : When he has no notion of an entity or a non-entity.🔽Subhuti : What then is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, full attainment?🔽The Lord : When he has no notion of an entity or a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar rig par bya'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar rig par bya'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Subhuti, by this method also should you know that all dharmas are without own-being.🔽Subhuti: The Perfection of Wisdom of the Great Vehicle

original: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhuti addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: if all dharmas are without own-being,

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs @60b rgyas la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs @60b rgyas la /
translated: Lord, how has the Tathagata, by fully knowing that all dharmas are without own-being,

original: gang dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
analyzed: gang dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur /
translated: attained the unequalled, supreme enlightenment, and become the universal knower of the field of all dharmas?

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la nga sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la nga sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: “Su­bhūti, previously, when I was practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva on the levels, in order to perfect the six transcendent perfections, I remained in solitude,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa nas /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa nas /
translated: isolated from the pursuit of evil and unwholesome states,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas la /🔽ngas bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas la / ngas bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gi mtshan ma bzung yang /
translated: up to and including the fourth meditative concentration.🔽I apprehended the attributes of those meditative concentrations and the branches of the meditative concentrations,

original: bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gis rlom sems su ma byas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag gis rlom sems su ma byas /
translated: but I did not become conceited about those meditative concentrations and the branches of the meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi ro myang ba ma byas /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi ro myang ba ma byas /
translated: I did not savor the meditative concentrations,

original: bsam gtan rnams la dmigs pa ma byas shing /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la dmigs pa ma byas shing /
translated: I did not focus on the meditative concentrations,

original: nga bsam gtan de dag gi rnam pa yongs su dag pa la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: nga bsam gtan de dag gi rnam pa yongs su dag pa la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: and I entered into the meditative absorption of the pure aspects of those meditative concentrations.

original: rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir te sems mngon par gzhol bar byas so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir te sems mngon par gzhol bar byas so //
translated: He focused his mind on the supernormal knowledge of magical powers,

original: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par gzhol bar bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lha'i mig gi shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par gzhol bar bya ste /
translated: the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear, the supernormal knowledge of knowing others’ minds, the supernormal knowledge of recollecting former lives, and the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye.

original: ngas mngon sum du bya ba de dag gi mtshan ma bzung yang mngon par shes pa de dag gis rlom sems su ma byas /
analyzed: ngas mngon sum du bya ba de dag gi mtshan ma bzung yang mngon par shes pa de dag gis rlom sems su ma byas /
translated: “I apprehended the signs of those supernormal knowledges, but I did not become proud on account of those supernormal knowledges.

original: ro myang ba ma byas /
analyzed: ro myang ba ma byas /
translated: I did not relish them,

original: dmigs pa ma byas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ma byas te /
translated: I did not make them into a basis.

original: nga mngon par shes pa de dag la nam @61a *//
analyzed: nga mngon par shes pa de dag la nam @61a *//
translated: “Subhūti, I entered into those supernormal knowledges

original: mkha' lta bur mthong bas snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: mkha' lta bur mthong bas snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: as if they were space.

original: rab 'byor / ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis 'di ni sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis 'di ni sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: Subhūti, with the wisdom of one instant I saw that this is suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin no //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin no // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa yin no //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan zhing /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I have the ten tathāgata powers and

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pas sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung ston to //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pas sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung ston to // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and I have given prophecies to beings in three groups.🔽The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gtan bzhi ji ltar bskyed lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gtan bzhi ji ltar bskyed lags /
translated: How could the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha generate the four concentrations that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par shes pa drug ji ltar bskyed lags /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par shes pa drug ji ltar bskyed lags /
translated: How could he generate the six clairvoyances that have the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: sems can ma mchis par yang sems can rnams phung po gsum du ji ltar lung bstan lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sems can ma mchis par yang sems can rnams phung po gsum du ji ltar lung bstan lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: How could he prophesy the three vehicles for beings who do not exist?”

original: rab 'byor / gal te 'dod pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te 'dod pa rnams sam /
translated: Subhūti having asked that, the Lord said to him, “Subhūti, if the intrinsic nature of the desire realm🔽or of the nonvirtuous dharmas

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos @61b rnams kyi ngo bo nyid cig yod par gyur tam /🔽rang gi dngos po'am /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos @61b rnams kyi ngo bo nyid cig yod par gyur tam / rang gi dngos po'am /
translated: were to exist,🔽whether it were to exist as its own thing or

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: as something else,

original: rab 'byor / nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po'am /🔽dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas par mi 'gyur ba zhig na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po'am / dngos po med pa'am /
translated: Subhuti: If, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom, he does not review form, etc. to : the knowledge of all modes, how then does he review the knowledge of the paths?

original: rang gi dngos po'am /🔽gzhan gyi dngos po med de /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'am / gzhan gyi dngos po med de /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, does not review the knowledge of the paths as a knowledge of the paths, nor does he review the knowledge of the paths as not a knowledge of the paths.

original: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas /🔽de'i phyir da sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas / de'i phyir da sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so on up to: the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: And why? Because that knowledge of the paths is empty of the knowledge of the paths, and so

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas par gyur to //
translated: He attained and dwelled in the first concentration, which is accompanied by investigation and analysis, and is born of seclusion, and is filled with delight and joy born of seclusion.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied up to the fourth concentration.

original: rab 'byor / gal te mngon par shes pa rnams dngos po'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te mngon par shes pa rnams dngos po'am /
translated: Subhūti, if the superknowledges were things,

original: rang gi dngos po'am /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'am /
translated: or had their own-nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin par gyur na ni /
translated: or had the nature of something else,

original: rab 'byor / ngas mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Subhūti, I would not have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having realized that all the superknowledges have the essence of nonthings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa thams cad la dngos po med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar mngon par shes pa thams cad la dngos po med de /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all the superknowledges are nonthings,

original: rang gi @62a *//
analyzed: rang gi @62a *//
translated: not having their own-nature,

original: dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po med la /
analyzed: dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po med la /
translated: and not having the nature of something else,

original: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud nas bla na
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mngon par shes pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du thugs su chud nas bla na
translated: Otherwise, since it would be the very nature of nonthings, therefore the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly complete buddha would have realized all the superknowledges to be the nature of nonthings, and then would have attained the highest🔽

original: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be just the nature of non-entityness, and therefore the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, having understood that all the superknowledges are the nature of non-entityness, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings, in all dharmas whose nature is non-entityness,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyur nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyur nas /
translated: fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by means of the four concentrations and five superknowledges,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord!

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: In the nonexistence of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bgyi ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i mthar gyis bgyi ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bgyi ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i mthar gyis bgyi ba dang /
translated: what is the gradual practice, the gradual training, and the gradual undertaking of the bodhisattva great beings by which they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa ji ltar mchis par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa ji ltar mchis par 'gyur lags /
translated: What is the gradual practice, the gradual training, and the gradual undertaking?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad @62b ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad @62b ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having asked that, the Lord said to him,🔽“Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the nonexistence of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog ma nyid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog ma nyid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, first of all from the Buddhas, the Lords, and from the Bodhisattvas who have set out for the supreme enlightenment, and from the Pratyekabuddhas, and from the Arhats, and from those who are in the state of a Non-returner,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: and from those who are in the state of a Once-returner, and from those who are in the state of a Streamwinner, hears this, that all dharmas are empty in their essential original nature.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /🔽tha na 'du byed thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid skra'i rtse mo'i cha'i gnas tsam yang med do zhes thos par gyur la /🔽thos nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'phags pa thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / tha na 'du byed thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid skra'i rtse mo'i cha'i gnas tsam yang med do zhes thos par gyur la / thos nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'di snyam du gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: the non-returners’ non-entityness, the once-returners’ non-entityness, the stream enterers’ non-entityness, the non-entityness of all the noble ones,🔽and even the non-entityness of the mere tip of a hair, which is the non-entityness of all conditioned things.🔽🔽Having heard that, the bodhisattva great being thinks, ‘If the lord buddhas and the stream enterers are non-entitynesses,🔽

original: gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur yang rung /
analyzed: gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur yang rung /
translated: the non-apprehension of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature of the arhats, the non-apprehension of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature of the pratyekabuddhas, the non-existence of an intrinsic nature of the śrāvaka vehicle, the non-apprehension of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature

original: gal te mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur yang rung ste /
translated: Even if I do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: all phenomena are just the nature of non-entities.

original: @63a *// bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na ni /
analyzed: @63a *// bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na ni /
translated: If I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la gnas pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la gnas pa /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽I will establish all sentient beings who stand in the perception of an entity

original: thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: in the nature of non-entities.’

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par 'jug go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par 'jug go /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to lead all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa.

original: de sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis gang la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis gang la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: He practices the six perfections,

original: de thog ma nyid du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob ste /
analyzed: de thog ma nyid du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob ste /
translated: beginning with generosity,🔽and he practices the four means of gathering disciples.🔽He practices the four immeasurables,🔽and he practices the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.🔽He practices the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽and he practices the four fearlessnesses and the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He practices the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and he practices the knowledge of all aspects.🔽He practices the perfection of generosity,🔽the perfection of good conduct,🔽the perfection of patience,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob bo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob bo //
translated: the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa na /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa na /
translated: “When he practices the perfection of generosity,🔽he himself gives gifts

original: bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la /
translated: and he encourages others to give gifts.

original: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la 'god cing sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la 'god cing sbyin pa'i bsngags pa'ang brjod la /
translated: He also encourages others to give and speaks in praise of generosity.

original: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi @63b bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi @63b bsngags pa'ang brjod cing rjes su dga' bar byed de /
translated: He speaks in praise of others who give gifts and rejoices in their generosity.

original: de sbyin pa la goms pa des longs spyod kyi phung po chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sbyin pa la goms pa des longs spyod kyi phung po chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through his familiarity with generosity, he obtains a great mass of wealth.

original: de ser sna dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /🔽zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
analyzed: de ser sna dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de / zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
translated: He gives gifts with a mind free of stinginess.🔽To those who want food, he gives food.

original: skom 'dod pa la ni skom /🔽bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa /🔽gos 'dod pa la ni gos /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la ni skom / bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa / gos 'dod pa la ni gos /
translated: To those who want drink, he gives drink.🔽To those who want vehicles, he gives vehicles.

original: spos 'dod pa la ni spos /🔽me tog phreng 'dod pa la ni me tog phreng /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa la ni spos / me tog phreng 'dod pa la ni me tog phreng /
translated: To those who want clothes, he gives clothes.🔽To those who want perfume, he gives perfume.

original: byug pa 'dod pa la ni byug pa /🔽mal 'dod pa la ni mal /
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa la ni byug pa / mal 'dod pa la ni mal /
translated: To those who want garlands, he gives garlands.🔽To those who want ointments, he gives ointments.🔽To those who want beds, he gives beds.

original: rgyab rten 'dod pa la ni rgyab rten /
analyzed: rgyab rten 'dod pa la ni rgyab rten /
translated: To those who want backrests, he gives backrests.

original: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
translated: To those who want dwellings, he gives dwellings.

original: mar me 'dod pa la ni mar me'am /
analyzed: mar me 'dod pa la ni mar me'am /
translated: To those who want lamps, he gives lamps.

original: mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba dag sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba dag sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives whatever human goods there are.

original: de sbyin pa de nyid kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po srung bar byed cing /
analyzed: de sbyin pa de nyid kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po srung bar byed cing /
translated: By means of that very giving, they protect the aggregate of morality.

original: sbyin pa de nyid dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of that very giving, morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge and vision of liberation, they transcend the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas kyang /
translated: Having transcended the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas kyang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: Having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: they purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: de nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Then they attain the knowledge of all aspects

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and set in motion the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum la 'god cing 'khor ba las yongs su grol bar byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum la 'god cing 'khor ba las yongs su grol bar byed do //
translated: having turned the wheel of the Dharma, he establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles and causes them to be completely freed from cyclic existence.

original: @64a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @64a *// rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pas mthar gyis bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pas mthar gyis bya ba yod de /
translated: thus there is a gradual practice in the generosity of bodhisattva great beings,

original: bya ba de dag thams cad kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bya ba de dag thams cad kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: but all those practices are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And why? Because they have no intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, from the time when the bodhisattva great beings first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
translated: they themselves practice the perfection of morality,

original: gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: and they encourage others to take up the perfection of morality.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dga' bar byed ces bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dga' bar byed ces bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, they rejoice in others doing the same, and so on.

original: de tshul khrims des lha'i che ba nyid dang / mi'i che ba nyid kyang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tshul khrims des lha'i che ba nyid dang / mi'i che ba nyid kyang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Through that morality, he attains the greatness of the gods and the greatness of humans.

original: de sems can dbul po rnams la nor sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de sems can dbul po rnams la nor sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives wealth to poor sentient beings.

original: byin nas kyang tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
analyzed: byin nas kyang tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
translated: Having given, he establishes them in morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang; rnam par grol ba dang / rnam bar grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang; rnam par grol ba dang / rnam bar grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them in meditative stabilization, in wisdom, in liberation, and in the knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that aggregate of morality, that aggregate of meditative stabilization, that aggregate of wisdom, that aggregate of liberation, and that aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, he transcends the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: 'das nas kyang tshul khrims kyi phung po nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i bar de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'das nas kyang tshul khrims kyi phung po nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'i bar de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Having passed beyond, he enters into the faultlessness of the Bodhisattva by means of that very aggregate of morality up to the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su grol bar byed pa'i @64b bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su grol bar byed pa'i @64b bar du sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, he causes beings to be completely liberated from cyclic existence.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyis mthar gyis bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyis mthar gyis bya ba yod de /
translated: Subhuti, in this way the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva's morality has a sequence of actions.

original: bya ba de dag kyang thams cad kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bya ba de dag kyang thams cad kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: And those actions are also all non-apprehensible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because they have no intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: bdag nyid kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: himself practices the perfection of patience,

original: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: He also inspires others to take up the perfection of patience.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies up to rejoicing.

original: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “When he practices the perfection of patience,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
translated: he satisfies beings with gifts,

original: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
translated: establishes them in morality,🔽establishes them in meditative stabilization, up to establishes them in the wisdom that sees liberation.

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i bar la 'god par byed do; ;de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i bar la 'god par byed do; ;de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang /
translated: With that aggregate of morality, aggregate of meditative stabilization, aggregate of wisdom, aggregate of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, he surpasses the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and having transcended the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, they will attain enlightenment.🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings themselves exert themselves at wholesome dharmas,🔽and they encourage others to take up perseverance.🔽…

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson par byed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bdag nyid kyang dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson par byed la /
translated: and they encourage others to take it up.🔽…🔽and they encourage others to take it up.🔽…🔽and they encourage others to take it up.🔽…

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and they encourage others to take it up.🔽…

original: gzhan dag kyang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la 'god par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag la 'god par byed cing /
translated: They also establish others in the formless absorptions.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed do //
translated: They speak in praise of the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions.

original: gzhan gang dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed pa nas /🔽rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag gi bsngags pa'ang rjod par byed pa nas / rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They speak in praise of those who enter the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions, and they go on to rejoice in them.

original: de bsam gtan de dag dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: de bsam gtan de dag dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la gnas nas /
translated: “They abide in those meditative stabilities, those immeasurable aspirations, and those formless absorptions,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
translated: and they satisfy beings with generosity.

original: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /🔽bzod pa la 'god par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god par byed / bzod pa la 'god par byed /
translated: They establish them in ethical discipline.🔽They establish them in patience.

original: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
translated: They establish them in perseverance.

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
translated: They establish them in meditative concentration.

original: shes rab la 'god par byed; rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed /
analyzed: shes rab la 'god par byed; rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed /
translated: they establish them in wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
translated: and they establish them in the seeing of liberated wisdom.

original: de rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs @65b rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs @65b rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “With that seeing of liberated wisdom, they transcend the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: 'das nas kyang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba des byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa nas; de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'das nas kyang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba des byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa nas; de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Having transcended them, with that seeing of liberated wisdom they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva and attain the knowledge of path aspects, and so on, up to they attain the knowledge of all aspects, and so on, up to they attain the knowledge of all modes, and so on, up to they attain the knowledge of all the aspects of phenomena, and so on, up to they attain the knowledge of the aspects of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pas tshim par byed /
translated: satisfy beings with giving,

original: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /
translated: establish them in morality,

original: bzod pa la 'god par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa la 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them in patience.

original: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them in perseverance.

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them in meditative stabilization.

original: shes rab la 'god par byed /
analyzed: shes rab la 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them in wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them in liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them in the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
translated: “When he practices the perfection of wisdom, he himself gives gifts,

original: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
translated: he himself guards morality,

original: bzod pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa sgrub par byed /
translated: he himself achieves patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: he himself exerts perseverance,

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
translated: he himself becomes absorbed in meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab sgom bar byed; gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la 'god par byed /
analyzed: shes rab sgom bar byed; gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la 'god par byed /
translated: he himself develops wisdom, and he establishes others in giving gifts,

original: tshul khrims la 'god par byed /🔽bzod pa la 'god par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god par byed / bzod pa la 'god par byed /
translated: in guarding morality,🔽in achieving patience,

original: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la 'god par byed /
translated: in exerting perseverance,

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'god par byed /
translated: in becoming absorbed in meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab la 'god par byed pa nas rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes rab la 'god par byed pa nas rjes su dga' bar byed pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: and in developing wisdom, up to rejoicing in them.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @66a *//
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @66a *//
translated: They are the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das te /
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom. Endowed with those perfections and with skill in means, they surpass the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba nas /
translated: enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, and they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: They are connected with the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa'ang yod do; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa'ang yod do; ;rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, that is how there is the bodhisattva great beings’ gradual practice, gradual training, and gradual work.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa la slob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis sgrub pa la slob ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva trains in the gradual activities, the gradual trainings, and the gradual accomplishments.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas bzung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos te /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas bzung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos te /
translated: From the very first production of the thought of awakening, with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects, they believe that all phenomena are the nature of non-entityness.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa sgom mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of giving, and the recollection of the deities.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas cultivate the recollection of the Buddha?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @66b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gzugs su yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @66b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gzugs su yid la mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not mentally engage with the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, as form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par yid la mi byed do //
translated: He does not mentally engage with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzugs la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Because form has no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med la /
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med la /
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness have no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recollection of the Buddha is not something to be recollected or mentally engaged with.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su yid la mi bya'o //🔽sku gser gyi kha dog can du yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su yid la mi bya'o // sku gser gyi kha dog can du yid la mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha should not be mentally attended to as the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: 'od 'dom gang bar yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang bar yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be mentally attended to as having a body the color of gold.🔽He should not be mentally attended to as having a fathom-wide aura.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i tshul gyis yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i tshul gyis yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be mentally attended to as having the eighty minor marks.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar sku de la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sku de la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Because that body has no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yin la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yin la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recollection of the Buddha is not a recollection, and it is not an action.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni tshul khrims kyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni tshul khrims kyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha should not be mentally attended to as the aggregate of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He should not pay attention to the aggregate of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung por yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He should not pay attention to the aggregate of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung por yid la mi bya'o //🔽rnam par grol ba'i ye shes @67a *//
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung por yid la mi bya'o // rnam par grol ba'i ye shes @67a *//
translated: He should not pay attention to the aggregate of liberation.

original: mthong ba'i phung por yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phung por yid la mi bya'o //
translated: He should not pay attention to the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Because it has no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What has no intrinsic nature is not a thing.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recollection of the Buddha is not something to be recollected or paid attention to.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur yid la mi bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas should not be paid attention to as the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du yid la mi bya'o //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should not be mentally constructed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: It is because they do not have an intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what does not have an intrinsic nature is a nonexistent thing.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recollection of the Buddha is not something to be recollected and is not something to be mentally constructed.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar yid la mi bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, you should not mentally construct the Tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha as dependent origination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because he does not have an intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what does not have an intrinsic nature is a nonexistent thing.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recollection of the Buddha is not a recollection and not a mental attention.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar sangs rgyas yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar sangs rgyas yid la bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should pay attention to the Buddha in that way.

original: de ltar na byang @67b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na byang @67b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa'ang yod de /
translated: In that way, bodhisattva great beings have a gradual practice, a gradual training, and a gradual entrance.

original: mthar gyis bslab pa 'di la slob cing /
analyzed: mthar gyis bslab pa 'di la slob cing /
translated: They train in this gradual training,

original: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa la slob pa na /
analyzed: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa la slob pa na /
translated: and while training in the gradual training and the gradual entrance,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: they complete the four establishments of mindfulness by way of the emptiness of non-apprehension and the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the emptiness meditative stabilization,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: the signless meditative stabilization, and the wishless meditative stabilization.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They complete the knowledge of path aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: des chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /🔽de la ngo bo nyid kyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: des chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste / de la ngo bo nyid kyi 'du shes sam /
translated: They fully awaken to all dharmas just as they are, with no intrinsic nature.🔽There is no perception of an intrinsic nature

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: or of the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings cultivate the recollection of dharmas?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
translated: should not pay attention to virtuous dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
translated: They should not pay attention to nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: lung bstan du yod pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams @68a *//
analyzed: lung bstan du yod pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams @68a *//
translated: They should not pay attention to dharmas with or without outflows, to dharmas that are mundane or supramundane, to dharmas that are of the noble ones or not of the noble ones,

original: dang; zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams dang /
