analyzed: dang; zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa rnams dang / ma gtogs pa rnams dang /
translated: to dharmas that are included in the desire realm, to dharmas that are included in the form realm, to dharmas that are included in the formless realm, or to dharmas that are not included in those.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams yid la mi bya'o //
translated: They should not pay attention to conditioned dharmas or to unconditioned dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In this way, those dharmas have no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And what has no intrinsic nature is a non-entity.

original: de bas na chos rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing yid la bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mindfulness of dharmas is not something to be mindful of, and is not something to be mentally attended to.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings 'di la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings 'di la bslabs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one trains in this dharma-constituent, which is the mode of non-entityness, one attains up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: des chos rnams dngos po med pa kho nar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /🔽de la dngos po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: des chos rnams dngos po med pa kho nar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te / de la dngos po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: One will fully awaken to the fact that dharmas are just non-entities.🔽Therein, there is no perception of entity,

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: and no perception of non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rjes su dran pa de ltar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rjes su dran pa de ltar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should cultivate the mindfulness of dharmas in that way.

original: de la ni dran pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang med na /
analyzed: de la ni dran pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang med na /
translated: Therein, there is not even the subtlest dharma of mindfulness,

original: dran pa dang bral ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: dran pa dang bral ba lta ci smos /
translated: let alone something separate from mindfulness.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how should bodhisattva great beings cultivate the recollection of the Saṅgha?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dge 'dun rjes su dran par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dge 'dun rjes su dran par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should recollect the Saṅgha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: nyan @68b thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu zung bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag ya brgyad gang yin pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: nyan @68b thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu zung bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag ya brgyad gang yin pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: the Saṅgha of śrāvakas—the four pairs of individuals, the eight types of individuals—lack any essence.

original: skyes bu zung bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag ni ngo bo nyid med cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis phye ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu zung bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag brgyad po de dag ni ngo bo nyid med cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis phye ba yin te /
translated: The four pairs of individuals and the eight types of individuals are distinguished by being essentially nonexistent and essentially non-things.

original: de ni dngos po med pa nyid du yid la byas te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa nyid du yid la byas te /
translated: One should bring to mind that they are essentially nonexistent and essentially non-things.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa nas dge 'dun rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa nas dge 'dun rjes su dran pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: From the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects onward, the recollection of the Saṅgha is not something to be recollected.

original: yid la bya ba ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid la bya ba ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: up to: it is not to be mentally constructed.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun rjes su dran pa de ltar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun rjes su dran pa de ltar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is how Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas should cultivate the recollection of the Saṅgha.

original: de la ni dran pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang med do //
analyzed: de la ni dran pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang med do //
translated: In it, there is not even an atom of a dharma that can be recollected.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims rjes su dran pa ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas cultivate the recollection of morality?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Subhūti, here Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment onward,

original: skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / nag nog med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang; shin tu rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims la zhugs nas tshul khrims de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed de /
analyzed: skyon med pa dang / ma nyams pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / nag nog med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang; shin tu rdzogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims la zhugs nas tshul khrims de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed de /
translated: He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.

original: de la dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med pa de lta bur yid la byed do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar te /🔽de la dngos po'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: de la dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med pa de lta bur yid la byed do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar te / de la dngos po'i 'du shes sam /
translated: He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub @69a *//
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes med do // rab 'byor / byang chub @69a *//
translated: He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gtong ba rjes su dran pa ji ltar yid la bya zhe na /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gtong ba rjes su dran pa ji ltar yid la bya zhe na /
translated: He attends to it in such a way that there is not even the subtlest karma.🔽He attends to it

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis zang zing gtong ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis zang zing gtong ba'am /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, should recollect the giving of material things

original: chos gtong ba rjes su dran par bya ste /🔽gtong ba des sbyin no snyam pa'am /
analyzed: chos gtong ba rjes su dran par bya ste / gtong ba des sbyin no snyam pa'am /
translated: and the giving of Dharma.🔽They should not arouse the thought, ‘I am giving through that giving,

original: mi sbyin no snyam pa'am /
analyzed: mi sbyin no snyam pa'am /
translated: or I am not giving through that giving,

original: yongs su gtang ngo snyam pa'am /🔽yongs su mi gtang ngo snyam du sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gtang ngo snyam pa'am / yongs su mi gtang ngo snyam du sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: or I am giving up,🔽or I am not giving up.’

original: yan lag dang nying lag rnams yongs su gtong bar yang sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rnams yongs su gtong bar yang sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not arouse the thought, ‘I am giving up my major and minor body parts.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they have no intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar de gtong ba rjes su dran pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de gtong ba rjes su dran pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Thus they practice recollecting that giving.

original: de ltar slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rim gyis thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rim gyis thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If they train like that, they will gradually attain up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gtong ba rjes su dran pa de lta de ltar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gtong ba rjes su dran pa de lta de ltar yid la bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should pay attention to giving in such and such a way.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas lha rjes su dran pa ji ltar yid la bya zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas lha rjes su dran pa ji ltar yid la bya zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom pay attention to the gods?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dag dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi nang du @69b skyes pa'i lha de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dag dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi nang du @69b skyes pa'i lha de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis yid la bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings should pay attention to those gods—stream enterers born among the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods, and so on up to those born among the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods—in terms of the mode of nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: They have no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what has no intrinsic nature is a nonexistent thing.”

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lha de dag de ltar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lha de dag de ltar yid la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should bring to mind those gods in the manner of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de la dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med de /
analyzed: de la dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med de /
translated: There is not even the slightest action of mindfulness there.

original: de ltar yid la byed cing rim gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed cing rim gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yid la byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one should bring to mind in that way, and gradually one will bring to mind up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha phyir mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gzugs na spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha phyir mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la byed do //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, those gods who are non-returners in the form realm and formless realm bring to mind those gods in the manner of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de dag la ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: They have no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature is non-existent.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lha de dag rjes su dran par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lha de dag rjes su dran par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should recollect those gods in the manner of the non-existence of an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and similarly, up to the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su dran pa drug po dag de ltar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su dran pa drug po dag de ltar yid la bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should pay attention to the six recollections in this way.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rjes su dran pa drug yid la byed pa mthar gyis bya ba'ang yod /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rjes su dran pa drug yid la byed pa mthar gyis bya ba'ang yod /
translated: Subhūti, in this way there is a bodhisattva great being’s attention to the six recollections, a gradual practice,

original: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa'ang yod de //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyi @70a *//
analyzed: mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis 'jug pa'ang yod de // rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthar gyis bya ba dang / mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyi @70a *//
translated: a gradual training, and a gradual engagement.

original: bsgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis nang stong pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to complete the gradual practice, the gradual training, and the gradual accomplishment should train in inner emptiness,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: up to train in the emptiness of its own mark, in the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la bslab par bya'o //
translated: They should train in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: snying rje chen po'i bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in , up to and including great compassion.

original: de de ltar byang chub kyi lam la slob na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar byang chub kyi lam la slob na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When they train in the path to enlightenment in that way, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood with respect to all dharmas, which are essentially nothing whatsoever.

original: de la ni dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med na gzugs lta ci smos /
analyzed: de la ni dran pa'i las phra rab tsam yang med na gzugs lta ci smos /
translated: In that respect, there is not even the slightest trace of the activity of mindfulness, let alone form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could there be , up to and including omniscience?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i mthar gyis bya ba'ang yod; mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa'ang yod la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i mthar gyis bya ba'ang yod; mthar gyis bslab pa dang / mthar gyis bsgrub pa'ang yod la /
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should therefore engage in gradual activity, gradual training, and gradual practice.

original: de la ni sems kyi spyod pa'i bya ba dang / sems kyi spyod pa'i bslab pa dang / sems kyi spyod pa'i lam yang med do; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de la ni sems kyi spyod pa'i bya ba dang / sems kyi spyod pa'i bslab pa dang / sems kyi spyod pa'i lam yang med do; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: 'o na ni gzugs kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs kyang ma mchis /
translated: then form will not exist,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang ma mchis /🔽phung po rnams kyang ma mchis /🔽khams rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du'ang ma mchis / phung po rnams kyang ma mchis / khams rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: up to consciousness will not exist;🔽the aggregates will not exist;🔽the constituents will not exist;

original: skye mched @70b rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: skye mched @70b rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: the sense fields will not exist;

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: the applications of mindfulness will not exist;

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar du'ang ma mchis /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects will not exist;

original: sangs rgyas kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang ma mchis /
translated: a buddha will not exist;

original: chos kyang ma mchis; dge 'dun yang ma mchis /
analyzed: chos kyang ma mchis; dge 'dun yang ma mchis /
translated: the Dharma will not exist; the Saṅgha will not exist;

original: lam kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: lam kyang ma mchis /
translated: the path will not exist;

original: 'bras bu'ang ma mchis /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma mchis / kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: there would be no effect;🔽there would be no defilement;

original: rnam par byang ba'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang ma mchis /
translated: there would be no purification;

original: thob pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: thob pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: there would be no attainment;

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
translated: there would be no clear realization.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang ma mchis par 'gyur lags so //
translated: And so on up to: all dharmas would not exist.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad la yod pa'am /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad la yod pa'am /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: med par dmigs su yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: med par dmigs su yod snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord, could one apprehend in any dharma at all, by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, either existence or nonexistence?”🔽He said, “Subhūti, what do you think, could one apprehend in any dharma at all, by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, either existence or nonexistence?”

original: de ni ma lags te /🔽dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad la ni mchis pa'am /
analyzed: de ni ma lags te / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad la ni mchis pa'am /
translated: He said, “Lord, no it could not.

original: ma mchis pa mi dmigs lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis pa mi dmigs lags so //
translated: In any dharma at all, by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, one could not apprehend either existence or nonexistence.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: “Subhūti, if all dharmas are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs med pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar du med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i bar du de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, just as there is no form, up to and including no consciousness, and no attainment and no clear realization, and so forth,

original: de lta bur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be like that?

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Su­bhūti then made the following statement to him:

original: bcom ldan @71a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan @71a *//
translated: “O Lord!

original: 'das bdag ni chos 'di dag la yid gnyis mi 'tshal /
analyzed: 'das bdag ni chos 'di dag la yid gnyis mi 'tshal /
translated: I do not doubt these teachings,

original: the tshom mi 'tshal lags mod kyi /
analyzed: the tshom mi 'tshal lags mod kyi /
translated: nor am I uncertain about them.

original: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnams 'di skad du gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can khyim pa rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnams 'di skad du gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: Nevertheless, in the future time, householders and renunciates, followers of the Śrāvakayāna, followers of the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and followers of the Bodhisattva­yāna will say, ‘If all things have the intrinsic identity of an absence of intrinsic nature,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la 'dir su zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes mchi bar 'gyur te /🔽de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma 'tshal nas tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la 'dir su zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes mchi bar 'gyur te / de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma 'tshal nas tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur /
translated: Who here would be defiled or purified with regard to all phenomena, which are essentially devoid of real entities?

original: lta ba nyams par 'gyur /🔽spyod pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta ba nyams par 'gyur / spyod pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: They will not understand defilement and purification, and so their morality will be impaired, their views will be impaired, and their conduct will be impaired.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa dang lta ba nyams pa dang / spyod pa nyams pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa dang lta ba nyams pa dang / spyod pa nyams pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba'am /
translated: Those whose morality is impaired, whose views are impaired, and whose conduct is impaired will go to the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts,

original: 'gro ba gsum po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu mchi bar 'tshal bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: 'gro ba gsum po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu mchi bar 'tshal bar bgyi lags so //
translated: or to one of the three realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dogs pa 'di mthong bas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di nyid zhus pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dogs pa 'di mthong bas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don 'di nyid zhus pa lags te /
translated: I have seen this future doubt and have asked the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One about this matter.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag ni chos de dag la yid gnyis mi 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdag ni chos de dag la yid gnyis mi 'tshal /
translated: Blessed One,

original: the tshom mi 'tshal lags so //
analyzed: the tshom mi 'tshal lags so //
translated: I do not have any doubt or uncertainty about these dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @71b bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @71b bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so!

original: khyod kyis ji skad smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad smras pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,🔽this is the seventy-first chapter,

original: mthar gyis bya ba dang bslab pa dang bsgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu pa'o ////
analyzed: mthar gyis bya ba dang bslab pa dang bsgrub pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu pa'o ////
translated: called “The Teaching on the Gradual Practice, Training, and Attainment.”

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are of the nature of non-existence,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: don ci zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du /
analyzed: don ci zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du /
translated: What is the meaning that the bodhisattva mahāsattvas see,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la zhugs lags /
translated: for the sake of which they have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug go /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to realize the nature of all things that is without entity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs pa ni tha chad yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs pa ni tha chad yin te /
translated: it is because the limited is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la ni thob pa'ang med /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la ni thob pa'ang med /
translated: Those who have the notion of an objective support have no attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med /
translated: no clear realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang med do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang med do //
translated: and no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He then said, “Lord,

original: ci dmigs su ma mchis pa la 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: ci dmigs su ma mchis pa la 'thob pa'am /
translated: is it the case that those who have no objective support have attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
translated: clear realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchis lags sam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchis lags sam /
translated: “Is there an unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi 'khrug pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid @72a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi 'khrug pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid @72a *//
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the dharma-constituent is not disturbed that nonapprehending

original: thob pa yin /
analyzed: thob pa yin /
translated: is attained;

original: mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa mngon par rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa mngon par rtogs pa yin /
translated: nonapprehending is realized;

original: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no //
translated: nonapprehending is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid 'thob pa'am /
translated: “Whoever wants to attain nonapprehending,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
translated: to realize it,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par 'dod du zad do //
translated: or to attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, would be wanting to disturb the dharma-constituent.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Subhūti said,

original: gal te dmigs su ma mchis pa la thob pa ma mchis /🔽mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: gal te dmigs su ma mchis pa la thob pa ma mchis / mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis /
translated: “Lord, if there is no attainment,🔽no realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis shing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis shing /
translated: and no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in nonapprehending,

original: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid thob pa lags /
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid thob pa lags /
translated: it is the attainment of non-apprehension;

original: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa lags /
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa lags /
translated: it is the realization of non-apprehension;

original: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags na /
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags na /
translated: it is the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of non-apprehension.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po ga la mchis /
translated: where is the first ground of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?

original: gnyis pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: gnyis pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: Where is the second?

original: bcu pa'i bar du'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: bcu pa'i bar du'ang ga la mchis /
translated: Up to where is the tenth?

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: Where is the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i chos gang dag la gnas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhal zas dang / btung ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i chos gang dag la gnas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhal zas dang / btung ba dang /
translated: What are the dharmas that arise from maturation, abiding in which they bring sentient beings to maturity, purify a buddhafield, and with food and drink,

original: na bza' dang / chibs pa dang / spos dang / me tog phreng ba dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / mar me dang / mi'i @72b phun sum tshogs pa dag gis bsnyen bskur bgyid la /
analyzed: na bza' dang / chibs pa dang / spos dang / me tog phreng ba dang / gzims cha dang / gdan dang / mar me dang / mi'i @72b phun sum tshogs pa dag gis bsnyen bskur bgyid la /
translated: and with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicine for curing the sick, and with the requisites of drinking water, washing water, flower garlands, ointments, dwellings, and lamps.

original: de'i de dag kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i de dag kyang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And those of theirs will not be interrupted,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams kyi bar dang / nyan thos rnams la rnam par smin bar bgyis kyang bas par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams kyi bar dang / nyan thos rnams la rnam par smin bar bgyis kyang bas par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: let alone the superknowledges that arise from evolution,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: let alone the generosity that arises from evolution,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung pa'i tshul khrims kyang ga la mchis /🔽rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i bzod pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung pa'i tshul khrims kyang ga la mchis / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i bzod pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: let alone the morality that arises from evolution,🔽let alone the patience that arises from evolution,🔽let alone the effort that arises from evolution,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyang ga la mchis /
translated: let alone the concentration that arises from evolution,🔽let alone the wisdom that arises from evolution,🔽let alone the fruit of evolution of the Buddha’s relics,🔽let alone the fruit of evolution of the disciples.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang ga la mchis /
translated: How could there be a concentration arisen from the maturation of past actions?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang ga la mchis /
translated: How could there be wisdom arisen from the maturation of past actions?🔽The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,🔽“Lord, if all dharmas are empty, how can there be an emptiness of emptiness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of the conditioned?🔽How can there be an emptiness of the unconditioned?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: How can there be an emptiness of what is not to be discarded?🔽How can there be an emptiness of intrinsic nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of otherness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of nonexistence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of existence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of essential nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of all dharmas?🔽How can there be an emptiness of emptiness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of great extent?🔽How can there be an emptiness of ultimate reality?🔽How can there be an emptiness of conditioned and unconditioned?

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir dmigs su med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir dmigs su med pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: How can there be an emptiness of what is not to be discarded?🔽How can there be an emptiness of intrinsic nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of otherness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of nonexistence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of existence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of essential nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of all dharmas?

original: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar dag yod do //
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar dag yod do //
translated: How can there be an emptiness of emptiness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of great extent?🔽How can there be an emptiness of ultimate reality?🔽How can there be an emptiness of conditioned and unconditioned?🔽How can there be an emptiness of what is not to be discarded?🔽How can there be an emptiness of intrinsic nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of otherness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of nonexistence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of existence?🔽How can there be an emptiness of essential nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of all dharmas?

original: de nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'ang mchod pa 'byung ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis sems can rnams kyi don byed pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du'ang mchod pa 'byung ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga yod do //
translated: How can there be an emptiness of emptiness?🔽How can there be an emptiness of great extent?🔽How can there be an emptiness of ultimate reality?🔽How can there be an emptiness of conditioned and unconditioned?🔽How can there be an emptiness of what is not to be discarded?🔽How can there be an emptiness of intrinsic nature?🔽How can there be an emptiness of otherness?🔽How can there be

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yod do //🔽de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yod do // de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom that arise from the maturation of past actions.

original: de skad ces bka' @73a *//
analyzed: de skad ces bka' @73a *//
translated: Therefore, there are roots of virtue that arise from the maturation of past actions.

original: stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: dmigs su ma mchis pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: what is the difference between the nonapprehended and generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, and the superknowledges?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the distinction between them?”🔽The Lord having been asked that, said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs su med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi bar la ni tha dad du bya ba ci'ang med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs su med pa'i sbyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi bar la ni tha dad du bya ba ci'ang med do //
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference at all between the generosity that is not an objective support and the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang; mngon par shes pa de dag ni tha dad du bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang; mngon par shes pa de dag ni tha dad du bya bar bstan to //
translated: Subhūti, the generosity that is not a fetter, the morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, wisdom, and superknowledges that are not fetters are taught to be different.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa nas mngon par shes pa'i bar du ji ltar tha dad du bgyi bar bstan /
analyzed: gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa nas mngon par shes pa'i bar du ji ltar tha dad du bgyi bar bstan /
translated: how are the generosity that is not a fetter and the superknowledges taught to be different?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na sbyin par bya ba'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na sbyin par bya ba'ang mi dmigs /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom give gifts without apprehending the gift,

original: len pa po'ang mi dmigs /🔽sbyin pa po'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: len pa po'ang mi dmigs / sbyin pa po'ang mi dmigs /
translated: without apprehending the recipient,🔽without apprehending the giver,

original: sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: and without apprehending the gift.

original: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung bar byed 'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung bar byed 'o //
translated: He practices morality without apprehending morality.

original: bzod pa mi @73b dmigs par bzod pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa mi @73b dmigs par bzod pa skyed par byed do //
translated: He generates patience without apprehending patience.

original: brtson 'grus mi dmigs pas brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi dmigs pas brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: He makes an effort without apprehending an effort.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par byed do //
translated: He becomes absorbed in concentration without apprehending concentration.

original: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates wisdom without apprehending wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He practices the superknowledges without apprehending the superknowledges.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom par byed do //🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sgom par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom par byed do //🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the applications of mindfulness without apprehending the applications of mindfulness.🔽He cultivates the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path without apprehending the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum po stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du mi dmigs par sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum po stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du mi dmigs par sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the three concentrations, up to the emptiness concentration, the signless concentration, and the wishless concentration, but he does not apprehend them.

original: sems can mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He brings beings to maturity, but he does not apprehend beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: He purifies a buddhafield, but he does not apprehend a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
translated: He fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, but he does not apprehend the dharmas of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dmigs su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dmigs su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom that is not apprehended do that.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par dga'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par dga'o //
translated: Subhuti: So it is, O Lord.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan @74a *//🔽'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan @74a *// 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: The Lord: Therefore, then, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being who wants to know full enlightenment should train in just these perfections.

original: ji ltar sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin par bgyi /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, does a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, take hold of the six perfections?🔽How does he take hold of the four applications of mindfulness, etc. to: the Buddhadharmas?

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
translated: The Lord: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, does not make a basis of form, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes.

original: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ji ltar yongs su 'dzin par bgyid /
analyzed: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ji ltar yongs su 'dzin par bgyid /
translated: the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?🔽How do they embrace the three gateways to liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ji ltar yongs su 'dzin par bgyid /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ji ltar yongs su 'dzin par bgyid /
translated: How do they embrace the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great being?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa gang sbyin yang rung ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang sbyin yang rung ste /
translated: should give whatever gifts they give

original: sbyin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: while they are embraced by the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: and not otherwise.

original: tshul khrims gang bsrung ba dang / bzod pa gang bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims gang bsrung ba dang / bzod pa gang bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug kyang rung ste /
translated: whatever meditative stabilization they rest in,

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: all of that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan @74b du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan @74b du ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.🔽Whatever meditative stabilizations they rest in,

original: bsam gtan gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: all of that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.🔽Whatever immeasurables they rest in,

original: tshad med pa gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: all of that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.🔽Whatever formless absorptions they rest in,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang dag la snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: all of that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gang dag sgom pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gang dag sgom pa nas /
translated: “Those who cultivate the applications of mindfulness

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: … and similarly, connect this with each, up to

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: the eighty minor marks are also embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: They are not otherwise.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug ji ltar yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings embraced by the perfection of wisdom embrace the six perfections with one mind,

original: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du ji ltar yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du ji ltar yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: and similarly, up to how do they embrace the eighty minor marks?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa gang sbyin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa de ni gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang sbyin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa de ni gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever generosity he practices, he does not become one who perceives duality, since he is upheld by the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims gang srung ba de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //🔽bzod pa gang sgom pa de la gnyis kyi 'du @75a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims gang srung ba de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro // bzod pa gang sgom pa de la gnyis kyi 'du @75a *//
translated: Whatever morality he guards, he does not become one who perceives duality.

original: shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever patience he cultivates, he does not become one who perceives duality.

original: brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever effort he undertakes, he does not become one who perceives duality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever concentration he enters, he does not become one who perceives duality.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du mngon par sgrub pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du mngon par sgrub pa de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: up to whatever eighty minor marks he accomplishes, he does not become one who perceives duality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin yang de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du'ang mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa sbyin yang de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du'ang mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How is it that they give gifts without being those who have a dualistic notion of anything?

original: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du'ang mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du'ang mngon par sgrub la /
translated: Similarly, up to how is it that they accomplish the eighty minor marks

original: de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du'ang mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi 'du shes can du'ang mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: without being those who have a dualistic notion of anything?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: des sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de'i nang du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad 'dus par byas nas /
analyzed: des sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de'i nang du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad 'dus par byas nas /
translated: Having included all six perfections within that perfection of generosity,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: they give gifts.🔽Similarly, they perfect all the dharmas on the side of awakening up to the path,

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed cing lam gyi bar gyi nang der /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed cing lam gyi bar gyi nang der /
translated: and within that

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad 'dus par byas te lam sgom par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad 'dus par byas te lam sgom par byed do //
translated: He practices the path by combining all six perfections.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: de gang gi tshe sbyin pa sbyin pa @75b na zag pa med pa'i sems de la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe sbyin pa sbyin pa @75b na zag pa med pa'i sems de la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: when they give a gift, they give that gift while dwelling in that uncontaminated mind.

original: de zag pa med pa'i sems de la gnas te /🔽bdag gis su zhig la sbyin par bya /🔽ci zhig sbyin par bya /
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i sems de la gnas te / bdag gis su zhig la sbyin par bya / ci zhig sbyin par bya /
translated: Dwelling in that uncontaminated mind,🔽they do not see any sign of “I should give to someone,”🔽“I should give this,”

original: su zhig sbyin par byed snyam pa'i mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: su zhig sbyin par byed snyam pa'i mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: or “I should give.”

original: de mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems dang / zag pa dang bral ba dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems dang / zag pa dang bral ba dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: They give a gift with a mind free of signs, free of contaminants, free of craving, and free of ignorance.

original: des sems de'ang mi mthong la /
analyzed: des sems de'ang mi mthong la /
translated: They do not see that mind either.

original: des sbyin pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: des sbyin pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that generosity,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to he does not see all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ste /
translated: guard morality with a mind free from signs.

original: tshul khrims de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: tshul khrims de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see that morality,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to he does not see all dharmas.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis bzod pa sgom ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis bzod pa sgom ste /
translated: He cultivates patience with a mind free from signs.

original: bzod pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzod pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that patience,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: up to he does not see all dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see those buddha dharmas.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
translated: They practice diligence with a mind free from signs.

original: brtson 'grus de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: brtson 'grus de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see that diligence.

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see any dharma at all.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /🔽ting nge @76a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste / ting nge @76a *//
translated: They rest in meditation with a mind free from signs.

original: 'dzin de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
analyzed: 'dzin de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: They do not see that meditation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: They perfect all the buddhadharmas.

original: de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo;/
analyzed: de dag kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo;/
translated: They do not see those at all.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis shes rab sgom par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis shes rab sgom par byed de /
translated: They cultivate wisdom with a mind free from signs.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same goes for all the buddhadharmas.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom par byed pa nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi sgom par byed pa nas /
translated: They cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness with a mind free from signs.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyag cu'i bar du mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyag cu'i bar du mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He will manifest the thirty-two major marks of a superior man and the eighty minor marks.

original: de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the rest.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Blessed One,

original: mtshan ma ma mchis shing mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis shing mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: how can the perfection of generosity be fulfilled in phenomena that are signless and not brought about?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How can the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of insight be fulfilled?”

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i yan lag brgyad pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path completed?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How are the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations completed?

original: de bzhin gshegs @76b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @76b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How are the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha completed?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Venerable Subhūti having made this request, the Lord said to him,🔽“Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom complete the perfection of giving, and similarly, complete the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: give gifts with a mind free from signs.

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas nas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas nas /
translated: To those who want food, they give food,

original: mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed do //🔽nang gi yan lag dang nyid lag rnams sam /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed do // nang gi yan lag dang nyid lag rnams sam /
translated: up to giving whatever human necessities there are.🔽They give their inner and outer limbs,

original: phyi rol gyi chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / rgyal srid rnams brgyan cing slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / rgyal srid rnams brgyan cing slong ba rnams la sbyin par byed do //
translated: and their outer wives, sons, daughters, and kingdoms to beggars.

original: la la zhig der 'ongs nas de la 'di skad du khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di lta bu byin na /
analyzed: la la zhig der 'ongs nas de la 'di skad du khyod kyi sbyin pa 'di lta bu byin na /
translated: If someone comes there and says to them, “By giving this kind of gift

original: 'di ltar phan pa med pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phan pa med pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhes zer na /
translated: what will you do with this useless thing?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom think like this:

original: sems can 'di dag 'di skad du khyod kyi sbyin pa mi brtan pa byin pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhes gshe mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag 'di skad du khyod kyi sbyin pa mi brtan pa byin pa 'dis ci zhig bya zhes gshe mod kyi /
translated: “These beings are scolding me, saying, ‘What is the point of your unstable generosity?’🔽But I will give gifts, I will not not give gifts.’

original: 'on kyang bdag gis ni sbyin pa sbyin par bya'i bdag gis sbyin pa mi sbyin par mi bya'o snyam mo; ;des sbyin pa de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis ni sbyin pa sbyin par bya'i bdag gis sbyin pa mi sbyin par mi bya'o snyam mo; ;des sbyin pa de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar
translated: He dedicates that generosity to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, making it common to all sentient beings.

original: byed de / des yongs su bsngo ba na ci nas @77a *//
analyzed: byed de / des yongs su bsngo ba na ci nas @77a *//
translated: When he dedicates it, he dedicates it in such a way

original: mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de lta bu'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo bar byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de lta bu'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo bar byed de /
translated: that he does not see even a causal sign.

original: bdag gis ci zhig sbyin par bya /🔽gang la sbyin par bya /
analyzed: bdag gis ci zhig sbyin par bya / gang la sbyin par bya /
