translated: When he investigates in this way, he does not apprehend the intrinsic nature of form.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs te /
translated: up to the intrinsic nature of defiled and undefiled dharmas is not apprehended.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mos so //
translated: he believes that all dharmas are the nonexistence of intrinsic nature.

original: de de ltar mos la nang stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: de de ltar mos la nang stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: When he believes that, and practices the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na chos gang la'ang zhen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod na chos gang la'ang zhen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: up to the emptiness of its own mark, he does not cling to any dharma at all.🔽Whether it is form,

original: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /
translated: feeling,

original: 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du shes sam /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: or consciousness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly, connect this with each, up to

original: byang chub kyi bar gyi chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar gyi chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: whether it is any dharma up to awakening, he does not cling to it.

original: de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom, the nonexistence of intrinsic nature,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: he perfects the path to awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: He will perfect the six perfections, up to and including the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of detailed and thorough knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He will perfect the eighty minor marks.

original: @87a *// de rnam par smin pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i lam la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs shing rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
analyzed: @87a *// de rnam par smin pa'i chos byang chub sems dpa'i lam la gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs shing rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur na /
translated: “Having perfected the six perfections and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment while abiding in the bodhisattva path of maturation, he will perfect the superknowledges that arise from maturation.

original: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
translated: He will gather those beings who are to be gathered through generosity by means of generosity.

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag rnam par grol bas bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag rnam par grol bas bsdu bar bya ba dang / gang dag rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by morality, those who are to be gathered by meditative stabilization, those who are to be gathered by wisdom, those who are to be gathered by liberation, those who are to be gathered by the vision of the wisdom of liberation, he gathers them with the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: gang dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be established in the fruit of entering the stream, he establishes in the fruit of entering the stream.

original: gang dag la na gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag la na gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya ba dang / gang dag rang byang chub la dgod par bya ba dang /
translated: Those who are to be established in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, those who are to be established in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, those who are to be established in arhatship, those who are to be established in individual enlightenment,

original: gang dag byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni byang chub la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub la dgod par bya ba de dag ni byang chub la 'god par byed de /
translated: He establishes in Awakening those who are to be established in Awakening.

original: thams cad la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all.

original: de rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma dag byed cing /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma dag byed cing /
translated: He performs many kinds of miraculous feats.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi @87b bye ma snyed dag tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi @87b bye ma snyed dag tu 'gro ste /
translated: He goes to as many world-realms as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River.

original: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu rin po che ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu'i rin po che dag mngon par sprul nas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
analyzed: 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu rin po che ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu'i rin po che dag mngon par sprul nas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
translated: If he wishes, he conjures up precious things of whatever kind he wishes, and fulfills the wishes of sentient beings.

original: cing 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro'o //
analyzed: cing 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro'o //
translated: He goes from world-realm to world-realm.

original: des 'jig rten gyi khams de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi khams de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin par byed de /
translated: Having seen those world-realms, he takes up the adornments of a Buddha-field.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa ci 'dra ba dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na yongs su 'tshol ba med pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa dag kyang der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi longs spyod dang yongs su spyod pa ci 'dra ba dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag na yongs su 'tshol ba med pa gang yin pa de lta bu'i longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa dag kyang der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the enjoyments and possessions of the gods of Paranirmitavaśavartin, and whatever is not sought after in other buddha-fields, such enjoyments and possessions will appear there.

original: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: “He, through the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, up to the perfection of wisdom that have arisen from evolution, and the superknowledges that have arisen from evolution,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin pa des lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin pa des lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid la spyod pa na /
translated: and the path to enlightenment that has arisen from evolution, while practicing the knowledge of path aspects,

original: thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin nas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin nas /
translated: having gone beyond all,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gal te ji tsam du gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gal te ji tsam du gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin cing /
translated: If one does not grasp at form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / chos thams cad kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / chos thams cad kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin te /
translated: up to and does not grasp at consciousness, up to and does not grasp at all dharmas,

original: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: whether wholesome or unwholesome,

original: 'jig rten las 'das @88a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das @88a *//
translated: whether worldly or transcendent,

original: pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽zag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am / zag pa med pa'am /
translated: whether with outflows or without outflows,

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: whether compounded or uncompounded,

original: 'dus ma byas yongs su mi 'dzin pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na'ang de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yongs su mi 'dzin pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na'ang de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, in that buddhafield all enjoyments and all uses will be ungrasped.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are in a mode that cannot be apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: perfects the perfection of wisdom by way of the absence of marks.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid kyi le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang dmigs su med pa'i chos nyid kyi le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
translated: the chapter called “The Reality of the Absence of Marks and the Absence of Reference Points,” is the forty-first.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / rtsol ba ma mchis pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / rtsol ba ma mchis pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: How do bodhisattvas, in phenomena that are without marks, without striving, unmixed, and empty of their own marks, perfect the six perfections—the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin @88b pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin @88b pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How are the perfections of discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom cultivated and brought to completion?

original: zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos 'di dag la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba gdags lags /
analyzed: zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos 'di dag la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba gdags lags /
translated: How are these uncontaminated dharmas differentiated and designated?

original: 'di dag la tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar mchis lags /
analyzed: 'di dag la tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar mchis lags /
translated: How are they differentiated?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa lags /
translated: How is the perfection of generosity included within the perfection of wisdom?

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa lags /
translated: How are the perfections of discipline, patience, diligence, and concentration included within the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba gdags par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos 'di ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba gdags par 'gyur lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how can phenomena that are without defining characteristics, and that are of a single defining characteristic in being without defining characteristics, be differentiated and designated as distinct?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom abide in the five psycho-physical aggregates which are dream-like,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
translated: and they practice generosity.

original: tshul khrims srung bar byed /🔽bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung bar byed / bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: They maintain ethical discipline.🔽They cultivate tolerance.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: They undertake perseverance.

original: bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
translated: They become absorbed in meditative concentration.

original: shes rab sgom par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab sgom par byed do //
translated: They cultivate wisdom.

original: brag ca lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te /
analyzed: brag ca lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te /
translated: They abide in the five psycho-physical aggregates which are like echoes,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
translated: and they practice generosity.

original: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
translated: They practice discipline.

original: bzod pa sgom par byed /🔽brtson 'grus @89a *//
analyzed: bzod pa sgom par byed / brtson 'grus @89a *//
translated: They cultivate patience.

original: rtsom par byed /
analyzed: rtsom par byed /
translated: They make an effort at perseverance.🔽They become absorbed in concentration.

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed shes rab sgom par byed do //🔽mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po dag la gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed shes rab sgom par byed do // mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po dag la gnas te /
translated: They cultivate wisdom.

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
translated: They practice generosity,

original: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims srung bar byed /
translated: they guard morality,

original: bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: they cultivate patience,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: they make an effort at perseverance,

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
translated: they become absorbed in concentration,

original: shes rab sgom par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab sgom par byed do //
translated: and they cultivate wisdom.

original: phung po lnga po dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are like a dream,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: without defining characteristics.

original: phung po lnga po dag ni brag ca lta bu dang; mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag ni brag ca lta bu dang; mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are like an echo, like an apparition, like a mirage, like a magical illusion, and like a phantom,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: without defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rmi lam la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med la /
analyzed: rmi lam la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med la /
translated: Because dreams have no real essence at all,

original: brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and echoes, optical aberrations, mirages, magical displays, and phantoms have no real essence at all.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la ni mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la ni mtshan nyid med do //
translated: That which has no real essence has no defining mark.

original: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de la ni 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go /
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de la ni 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go /
translated: That which has no defining mark has a single defining mark, i.e., no defining mark.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / sbyin pa po'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / len pa po'i mtshan nyid med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / sbyin pa po'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / len pa po'i mtshan nyid med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, for this reason, among other things, you should know that the defining mark of generosity is non-existent, the defining mark of the giver is non-existent, and the defining mark of the recipient is non-existent.

original: gang gis de ltar shes nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs @89b par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs @89b par bya'o //
translated: When someone knows this and gives a gift, then the perfection of generosity is complete.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: When they make the perfection of generosity complete,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not turn away from the perfection of morality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not turn away from the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Abiding in these six perfections, he completes the four concentrations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He completes the four immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He completes the four formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He completes the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He completes the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: the four bases of supernatural powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, inner emptiness, and in the same vein as before, up to and including the emptiness of its own mark.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He will perfect the meditative absorption of emptiness, the meditative absorption of signlessness, and the meditative absorption of aspirationlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He will perfect the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge.

original: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He will perfect the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @90a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs @90a *//
translated: He will perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;de rnam par smin pas byung ba'i 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos 'di dag la gnas te /
analyzed: bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;de rnam par smin pas byung ba'i 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos 'di dag la gnas te /
translated: He will perfect the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: “Abiding in these noble dharmas that are uncontaminated and have arisen from maturation, he will go by his magical power to the world systems in the east and will serve the lord buddhas there.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gro'ang byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gro'ang byed do //
translated: He will also serve those lord buddhas.

original: der longs spyod dag gis sems can rnams kyi don yang byed do //
analyzed: der longs spyod dag gis sems can rnams kyi don yang byed do //
translated: He will also benefit sentient beings there with his enjoyments.

original: der sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: der sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
translated: He will gather those sentient beings who are to be gathered through generosity with generosity.

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni tshul khrims kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni tshul khrims kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: He will gather those who are to be gathered through morality with morality.

original: gang dag bzod pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni bzod pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag bzod pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni bzod pas sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by patience, he gathers by patience.

original: gang dag brtson 'grus kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni brtson 'grus kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag brtson 'grus kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni brtson 'grus kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by effort, he gathers by effort.

original: gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by meditation, he gathers by meditation.

original: gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by wisdom, he gathers by wisdom.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis bsdu bar bya ba'i bar gang yin pa de dag ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis bsdu bar bya ba'i bar gang yin pa de dag ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by all virtuous qualities, he gathers by all virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan pas 'khor ba'ang len par byed la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag dang ldan pas 'khor ba'ang len par byed la /
translated: Endowed with those virtuous qualities, he takes up cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba na yod @90b pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba na yod @90b pa'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he is not defiled by the sufferings that exist in cyclic existence.

original: sems can rnams kyi ched ru lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa dag kyang 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ched ru lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa dag kyang 'dzin par byed de /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he takes up the excellence of gods and humans.

original: phun sum tshogs pa de dag gis sems can de dag la phan 'dogs par byed do //🔽des mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams rtogs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang shes la /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa de dag gis sems can de dag la phan 'dogs par byed do // des mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams rtogs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang shes la /
translated: He benefits those sentient beings with those perfections.🔽“He knows the fruit of entering the stream, but does not rest in it,

original: de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: because he has realized that dharmas are without a real basis.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: He knows the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, but does not rest in it,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'ang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: He knows the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, but does not rest in it,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: He knows arhatship, but does not rest in it,

original: rang byang chub kyang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyang shes la de la gnas par yang mi byed do //
translated: He knows individual enlightenment, but does not rest in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar des thams cad rtogs nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar des thams cad rtogs nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa /
translated: And why?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has realized all dharmas, and he has not attained the knowledge of all modes that is not shared in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽“He knows the level of the śrāvakas, but does not rest in it,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag mtshan nyid med par shes la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par rtogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag mtshan nyid med par shes la /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, having realized that all phenomena are without defining characteristics, the bodhisattva great beings know that the six perfections are without defining characteristics.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang mtshan nyid med par shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang mtshan nyid med par shes so //
translated: They know that all the buddhadharmas are without defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @91a *//🔽phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @91a *//🔽phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream, complete the perfection of morality.

original: brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas te tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream, and they perfect the perfection of morality.

original: des rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag rtogs la /
analyzed: des rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag rtogs la /
translated: They understand the five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream.🔽They understand the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, an image, a mirage, an illusion, and a magical creation.

original: brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag kyang rtogs nas mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa dang /
analyzed: brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag kyang rtogs nas mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa dang /
translated: They perfect the perfection of morality which is without defining characteristics, and which is not broken.

original: skyon med pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / ma 'chol ba dang / nag nog med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang / shin tu rdzogs pa dang / 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i lam du gtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: skyon med pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / ma 'chol ba dang / nag nog med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang / shin tu rdzogs pa dang / 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i lam du gtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: It is without fault, unadulterated, unconfused, unblemished, mastered, praised by the wise, completely perfect, and included in the noble uncontaminated path.

original: de la gnas nas yang dag par blang ba /
analyzed: de la gnas nas yang dag par blang ba /
translated: Dwelling in that, he observes the discipline of correct adoption,

original: brda can gyi tshul khrims dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims dang; sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par rig byed kyi tshul khrims dang / yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: brda can gyi tshul khrims dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims dang; sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par rig byed kyi tshul khrims dang / yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: the discipline of the expression of words, the discipline of attaining the nature of things, the discipline of restraint, the discipline of expression, and the discipline of correct practice.

original: de tshul khrims de lta bu dag dang ldan yang 'dis bdag rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de tshul khrims de lta bu dag dang ldan yang 'dis bdag rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: “Although he observes such disciplines, he does not think, ‘May I be reborn equal in fortune to the great sāla-tree-like royal families,

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing @91b s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing @91b s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: those of the householder caste who are like great śāla trees,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'am /
translated: or those who are universal monarchs,

original: khams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: khams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ce'am /
translated: or those who are regional kings,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /🔽sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams sam /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams sam /
translated: or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: 'thab bral ba rnams sam /🔽dga' ldan pa rnams sam /
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams sam / dga' ldan pa rnams sam /
translated: or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Trāyastriṃśa realm,🔽or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Yāma realm,

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams sam /
translated: or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Tuṣita realm,🔽or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Nirmāṇarati realm,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: or those who are born in the same place as the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur cig ce'am /
translated: May I attain the fruit of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: or the state of an arhat.

original: rang byang chub thob par gyur cig ces mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par gyur cig ces mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: and ‘May I attain the state of a pratyekabuddha!’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad 'di lta ste /
translated: And why?🔽Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are of one single mark,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid pas mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid pas mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, the mark of the insubstantiality of nature.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A dharma without marks does not attain a dharma without marks.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos thob par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /🔽mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos thob par mi 'gyur ro // mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
translated: A dharma with different marks does not attain a dharma with different marks.🔽A dharma with different marks does not attain a dharma without marks.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A dharma without marks does not attain a dharma with different marks.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul @92a *//
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul @92a *//
translated: the way of the absence of characteristics

original: khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: perfects the perfection of morality.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having perfected the perfection of morality that is the way of the absence of characteristics, he enters into the certainty of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs te mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs te mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
translated: Having entered into the certainty of the bodhisattva and attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: he practices the knowledge of path aspects

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams thob la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams thob la /
translated: and attains the superknowledges that arise from maturation.

original: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya la gnas nas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob ste /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya la gnas nas so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob ste /
translated: Having attained the four detailed and thorough knowledges, he abides in the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /
translated: and goes from buddhafield to buddhafield

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'ang bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la'ang bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: and serves the lord buddhas

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: and brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He also takes possession of the Buddha-fields.

original: de 'khor ba'i 'gro ba lngar yang 'khor la /
analyzed: de 'khor ba'i 'gro ba lngar yang 'khor la /
translated: He also transmigrates in the five destinies of the world.

original: 'khor ba na spyod pa'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pas kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba na spyod pa'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pas kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he is not defiled by the ripening of the actions of those who transmigrate in the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sprul pa ni 'gro ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar yang byed la /
analyzed: dper na / sprul pa ni 'gro ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar yang byed la /
translated: For example, a magical creation walks, stands, sits, and lies down.

original: de la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'ang med de /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'ang med de /
translated: But it does not go, come, stand, sit, or lie down.

original: de ni sems can gyi don yang byed la /
analyzed: de ni sems can gyi don yang byed la /
translated: It also performs the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: But it does not apprehend sentient beings or the designation of sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @92b byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @92b byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: For example, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems can tshad med pa dag btul nas theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang byang chub sems dpa' gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa 'ga' yang ma mthong nas /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa dag btul nas theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang byang chub sems dpa' gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa 'ga' yang ma mthong nas /
translated: He had trained countless sentient beings and caused them to pass into complete nirvāṇa through the two vehicles, but he had not seen even one bodhisattva to whom the prophecy of unsurpassed and complete awakening had been given.

original: des tshe'i 'du byed bor te /
analyzed: des tshe'i 'du byed bor te /
translated: He then cast off the components of his life and,

original: sprul pa sprul nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: sprul pa sprul nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: having emanated emanations, passed into complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas.

original: rab 'byor / sprul pa des kyang bskal pa 'das kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sprul pa des kyang bskal pa 'das kyi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: Subhūti, those emanations gave prophecies to bodhisattvas of unsurpassed and complete awakening for eons, and then passed into complete nirvāṇa.

original: sprul pa de la'ang gzugs sam /
analyzed: sprul pa de la'ang gzugs sam /
translated: But in those emanations, no thing whatsoever of form,🔽feeling,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: or formation,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dngos po ci'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dngos po ci'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: or consciousness was apprehended.

original: rab 'byor; de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rab 'byor; de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being does not apprehend a being or the designation of a being,

original: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
translated: but still works for the welfare of beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yongs su rdzogs na chos thams cad nang du 'dus par 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yongs su rdzogs na chos thams cad nang du 'dus par 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: completes the perfection of morality, which includes all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i @93a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i @93a *//
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: phung po lnga po dag dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag dang / brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream, like a mirage, like an apparition, like a dream-object, and like a magical creation complete the perfection of patient acceptance without a distinguishing mark.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the five appropriating aggregates without a distinguishing mark complete the perfection of patient acceptance?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings complete the perfection of patient acceptance by means of two kinds of patient acceptance.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: mind,🔽up until he is seated at the site of awakening, should not, in the

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar skabs der sems can thams cad lhags nas /🔽spyos sam / brgyad dam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du bar skabs der sems can thams cad lhags nas / spyos sam / brgyad dam /
translated: meantime, allow any sentient beings to be excluded🔽from his patience, whether they are reviling him, beating him,

original: tshogs par mi dbyur ba'am /
analyzed: tshogs par mi dbyur ba'am /
translated: Do not be a nuisance in the assembly.

original: tshig rtsub po brjod kyang rung /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po brjod kyang rung /
translated: even killing him.🔽Even if they were to throw clods and sticks at him,🔽or

original: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis bsnun kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis bsnun kyang rung ste /
translated: strike him with swords,🔽the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to perfect the perfection of🔽patience should not allow even a single thought of anger to arise,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pas su zhig bdag la spyo bar byed ce'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pas su zhig bdag la spyo bar byed ce'am /
translated: thinking, “Who is reviling me?

original: brgyad par byed ce'am /
analyzed: brgyad par byed ce'am /
translated: Who is beating me?

original: tshogs par mi dbyung ba'am /
analyzed: tshogs par mi dbyung ba'am /
translated: Who is excluding me from the community?

original: tshig rtsub po brjod par byed ce'am /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po brjod par byed ce'am /
translated: Who is speaking harshly to me?

original: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon chas bsnun par byed ces 'khrug @93b pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon chas bsnun par byed ces 'khrug @93b pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Who is throwing clods and sticks at me, or striking me with swords?”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par bzod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par bzod na /
translated: In this way, if one can accept that all phenomena are without defining characteristics,

original: de la su zhig bdag la spyo bar byed ce'am /
analyzed: de la su zhig bdag la spyo bar byed ce'am /
translated: then how could anyone reproach,🔽criticize,

original: brgyad par byed ce'am /🔽tshogs par mi dbyung ba'am /
analyzed: brgyad par byed ce'am / tshogs par mi dbyung ba'am /
translated: or slander them,

original: tshig rtsub po brjod par byed ce'am /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po brjod par byed ce'am /
translated: or speak harshly to them,

original: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon chas bsnun par byed ces bya bar 'byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon chas bsnun par byed ces bya bar 'byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: or beat them with sticks, swords, or clods of earth?

original: de de ltar rtog na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar rtog na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: If one thinks in this way, one will perfect the perfection of patience.🔽“Having perfected the perfection of patience, one will attain the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.”

original: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa des na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa des na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro; ;de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni ci zhig lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni ci zhig lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena?

original: 'di'i tshad ni ji tsam lags /
analyzed: 'di'i tshad ni ji tsam lags /
translated: What is its measure?

original: shes pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: shes pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / chos phra rab tsam yang skye ba med pa de ni mi skye ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos phra rab tsam yang skye ba med pa de ni mi skye ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, the non-arising of even the most subtle of things is called ‘the non-arising of things.’

original: de la bzod pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la bzod pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That acceptance is called ‘knowledge.’

original: shes pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: shes pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: Through that knowledge, one attains the acceptance that phenomena are non-arising.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The venerable Su­bhūti then asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa @94a *//
analyzed: nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa @94a *//
translated: the acceptance that phenomena are non-arising of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa 'di gnyis la tha dad du bgyi ba ci zhig mchis lags de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa 'di gnyis la tha dad du bgyi ba ci zhig mchis lags de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: “Su­bhūti, the knowledge and abandonment of the stream enterer are the patience of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.🔽The knowledge and abandonment of the once-returner are the patience of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of the non-returner are the patience of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: That knowledge and abandonment of the arhats is the forbearance of the bodhisattva great being.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
translated: That knowledge and abandonment of the pratyekabuddhas is the forbearance of the bodhisattva great being.

original: rab 'byor / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the difference between the forbearance of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the forbearance of the bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bzod pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bzod pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who have such forbearance surpass all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de @94b rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i bzod pa la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod cing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de @94b rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i bzod pa la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod cing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Having stood in the forbearance that arises from the ripening of karma and is not produced, they practice the bodhisattva path and complete the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de yongs su rdzogs na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is complete, they will not be separated from the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless meditative stabilizations,

original: de mngon par shes pa lnga dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa lnga dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will not be separated from the five clairvoyances.

original: de mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag dang ma bral bas sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag dang ma bral bas sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: Not being separated from those five clairvoyances, they will also bring beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: and purify a buddhafield.

original: des sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byas nas /
analyzed: des sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byas nas /
translated: Having brought beings to maturity and purified a buddhafield,🔽they will attain the knowledge of all aspects in a single moment of wisdom.

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being completes the perfection of patience without defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas shing sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas shing sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: dwell in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream, and dwell in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a magical creation,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i lus dang sems kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par byed de /
translated: and with a body and mind without defining characteristics they practice diligence.

original: de lus kyi brtson 'grus kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub cing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams @95a *//🔽dag tu song nas /
analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub cing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams @95a *// dag tu song nas /
translated: With physical diligence they accomplish magical powers and go to the world systems of the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having gone there, they serve the lord buddhas and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de lus kyi brtson 'grus des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas /
analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas /
translated: Having brought beings to maturity through that physical effort,

original: theg pa gsum po dag la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag la 'god par byed do //
translated: he establishes them in the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: completes the perfection of effort that has no marks.

original: de sems kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa'i lam dang / lam du rtogs pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de sems kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa'i lam dang / lam du rtogs pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: Through the effort of the mind that realizes the uncontaminated path and the path, he completes the perfection of effort.

original: der ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: der ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, they are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the three gates of liberation, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus te /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and all wholesome dharmas are included.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @95b po de la spyod pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @95b po de la spyod pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing that should complete the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de yongs su rdzogs na bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs na bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is completed, they will abandon all the latencies.

original: des spangs shing mtshan nyid med pa yongs su grub pa /
analyzed: des spangs shing mtshan nyid med pa yongs su grub pa /
translated: Having abandoned them, they will have the perfected, which is without a defining mark.

original: yongs su rdzogs la snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthu bsgrubs nas chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs la snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthu bsgrubs nas chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Having accomplished the power of entering into complete absorption, he will turn the wheel of Dharma three times

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su skor ba bskor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su skor ba bskor bar 'gyur te /
translated: and in twelve aspects.

original: de bskor bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bskor bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
translated: When he turns it, the great trichiliocosm will shake in six ways,

original: rab tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rab tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
translated: it will shake intensely,

original: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar 'gyur /
translated: it will shake thoroughly and intensely,

original: 'gul bar 'gyur /🔽rab tu 'gul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gul bar 'gyur / rab tu 'gul bar 'gyur /
translated: it will tremble,🔽it will tremble intensely,

original: kun tu rab tu 'gul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'gul bar 'gyur /
translated: it will tremble thoroughly and intensely,

original: ldeg par 'gyur /🔽rab tu ldeg par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldeg par 'gyur / rab tu ldeg par 'gyur /
translated: it will quake,🔽it will quake intensely,

original: kun tu rab tu ldeg par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu ldeg par 'gyur zhing /
translated: it will quake thoroughly and intensely,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bas khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bas khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the entire great trichiliocosm will be filled with light.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de las sgra skad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de las sgra skad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: From that thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha, a voice will emerge

original: des sgra thos par byed do //
analyzed: des sgra thos par byed do //
translated: that will be heard.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis kyang sgra de thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis kyang sgra de thos par 'gyur te /
translated: And all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm hear that sound,

original: de dag thams cad theg pa gsum po dag la nges bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad theg pa gsum po dag la nges bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and all of them become delivered through the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de ltar gces spras byed pa yin te /🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha @96a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de ltar gces spras byed pa yin te / brtson 'grus kyi pha @96a *//
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of perseverance of bodhisattva great beings is thus cherished.

original: rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: Having stood in this perfection of perseverance, bodhisattva great beings complete all the buddhadharmas and reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bam po lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and complete the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: They stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an emanation

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar rmi lam lta bu nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar rmi lam lta bu nas /
translated: and complete the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream, up to like an emanation

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
