translated: and complete the perfection of meditative stabilization?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: attain and abide in the first concentration, and so on up to attain and abide in the fourth concentration.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas /🔽'du shes med /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas / 'du shes med /
translated: They attain and abide in loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, and in the sphere of infinite space up to

original: 'du shes med min skye mched @96b kyi bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched @96b kyi bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //
translated: They cultivate the concentrations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par ting nge 'dzin gang yang rung ba nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin tam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par ting nge 'dzin gang yang rung ba nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin tam /
translated: Except for the Tathāgata’s concentration, the lightning-like concentration, the correct concentration, and the vajra-like concentration, they attain and abide in any other concentration, whether a śrāvaka concentration or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin tam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin tam /
translated: or the samādhi of a pratyekabuddha,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs gzhan gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad lus kyis khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs gzhan gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad lus kyis khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas la /
translated: or any other samādhi, and he remains in them, pervading them with his body.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'ang myong bar mi byed ngo; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'ang myong bar mi byed ngo; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: He does not experience those samādhis or the results of those samādhis. And why?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has the perception that the defining characteristics of those samādhis are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar mi byed cing dngos po med pas dngos po med pa'i ro myong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar mi byed cing dngos po med pas dngos po med pa'i ro myong bar mi byed de /
translated: In that way, a dharma that has no defining characteristic does not experience the taste of a dharma that has no defining characteristic, and a nonexistent does not experience the taste of a nonexistent.

original: de ro myang bar mi byed pas na /
analyzed: de ro myang bar mi byed pas na /
translated: Since he does not experience the taste of those samādhis,🔽he does not fall under the power of any samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang gi dbang gis kyang 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang gi dbang gis kyang 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: He does not fall under the power of the desire realm,🔽the form realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: or the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not be reborn in the formless realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des khams de dag mi dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar des khams de dag mi dmigs la /
translated: It is because they do not apprehend those realms,

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cis snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽des mi dmigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cis snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // des mi dmigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: and they do not apprehend the one who enters into meditative stabilization and what they enter into meditative stabilization on.

original: ting nge @97a *//
analyzed: ting nge @97a *//
translated: By not apprehending anything, they complete the perfection of the meditative stabilization of the absence of attributes.

original: 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur ro // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Through that perfection of meditative stabilization, they surpass the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽Then the Lord said to venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'da' bar 'gyur lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings, having completed the perfection of meditative stabilization that has no marks, go beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nang stong pa nyid la legs par bslabs shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nang stong pa nyid la legs par bslabs shing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings have trained well in inner emptiness,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag la legs par bslabs pas na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag la legs par bslabs pas na /
translated: up to have trained well in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,🔽that they do not apprehend any dharma in this emptiness on which to stand,

original: stong pa nyid 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: whether it is the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: the result of non-returner,🔽the state of a worthy one,🔽a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽or even the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so; ;stong pa nyid de'ang stong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs so; ;stong pa nyid de'ang stong ste /
translated: That emptiness is also empty.

original: de stong pa nyid de dag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas /
analyzed: de stong pa nyid de dag gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas /
translated: Having transcended the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels by means of those emptinesses,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: they enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas.

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni gang lags /
translated: what are the faults of the bodhisattvas?

original: skyon ma mchis pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: skyon ma mchis pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is faultlessness?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' @97b sems dpa' chen po'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' @97b sems dpa' chen po'i skyon yin no //
translated: all reference points are faults for bodhisattva great beings.

original: dmigs pa med pa thams cad ni skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa thams cad ni skyon med pa yin no //
translated: All non-reference points are faultlessness.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: dmigs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gang lags /
translated: what is a reference point?

original: dmigs pa ma mchis pa ni gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa ma mchis pa ni gang lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is a non-reference point?”🔽The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: form is a reference point for bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are reference points for bodhisattva great beings.

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: the eyes, forms, the ears, sounds, the nose, smells, the tongue, tastes, the body, tangibles, the thinking mind, and dharmas are the bodhisattva great beings’ objective supports.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs pa ni skyon yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs pa ni skyon yin no //
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to: the knowledge of all aspects is the bodhisattva great beings’ objective support.

original: rab 'byor / skyon med pa ni gang la gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos 'di dag gi brjod pa'ang mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / skyon med pa ni gang la gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos 'di dag gi brjod pa'ang mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, the faultless is where these dharmas, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, are not apprehended even as a verbal expression.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni dmigs su med do //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of form is not apprehended.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing brjod du med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med cing brjod du med do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of form is not a thing and cannot be expressed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po med do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is not a thing.

original: brjod du med do //
analyzed: brjod du med do //
translated: “It is inexpressible.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ flawlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni skyon med pa la zhugs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni skyon med pa la zhugs nas /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings, having entered into flawlessness,

original: @98a *// ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yang byed la /
analyzed: @98a *// ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yang byed la /
translated: complete all the meditative stabilizations

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis kyang skye bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis kyang skye bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: and do not take birth through the power of meditative absorption.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis mi skye ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis mi skye ba lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to say more—they do not take birth through desire, anger, or ignorance.

original: de la gnas nas las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas bsam gtan bzhi las gang yang rung bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de la gnas nas las gang mngon par 'dus byas pas bsam gtan bzhi las gang yang rung bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las de mngon par 'du byed pa de ni gnas med do //
translated: There is no basis for the karma that is accumulated through the action that would cause them to take birth in any of the four meditative concentrations.

original: gzhan du na sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams la gnas nas sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed la /
analyzed: gzhan du na sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams la gnas nas sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed la /
translated: Other than that, they work for the welfare of beings while dwelling in illusion-like dharmas.

original: sems can yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can yang mi dmigs /
translated: They do not apprehend a being

original: sgyu ma'ang mi dmigs so; ;des mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang mi dmigs so; ;des mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: He brings beings to maturity without apprehending anything,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and he also takes hold of a buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings, having completed the perfection of meditative stabilization,🔽turn the wheel of the Dharma,

original: dmigs su med pa'i 'khor lo'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i bar du skor bar byed do //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i 'khor lo'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i bar du skor bar byed do //
translated: starting from the wheel of the Dharma that is not apprehended up to the wheel of the Dharma that is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su shes shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su shes shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom know all phenomena to be like a dream,

original: chos thams cad brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur yongs su shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bur yongs su shes so //
translated: and they know all phenomena to be like an echo, an apparition, a mirage, an illusion, and a magical creation.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan @98b 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan @98b 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su 'tshal cing /🔽chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yongs su 'tshal ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ji ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su 'tshal cing / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yongs su 'tshal ba lags /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom know all dharmas as like a dream,

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: and how should they know all dharmas as like a magical creation?”

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: are not dreamers of dreams,

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not dream-dreamers.

original: brag ca thos pa ma yin /
analyzed: brag ca thos pa ma yin /
translated: They are not hearers of echoes,

original: brag ca nyan pa po'ang ma yin no //🔽mig yor mthong ba ma yin /🔽mig yor mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: brag ca nyan pa po'ang ma yin no // mig yor mthong ba ma yin / mig yor mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not echo-hearers.🔽They are not viewers of optical illusions,🔽and they are not optical-illusion-viewers.

original: smig rgyu mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: smig rgyu mthong ba ma yin /
translated: They are not viewers of mirages,🔽and they are not mirage-viewers.

original: smig rgyu mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the one who sees the mirage.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the one who sees the magical display,

original: sgyu ma mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the one who sees the one who sees the magical display.

original: sprul pa mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the one who sees the emanation,

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the one who sees the one who sees the emanation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni phyin ci log yin la; byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni phyin ci log yin la; byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phyin ci log yin te /
translated: Because a dream, an echo, an optical aberration, a mirage, a magical display, and an emanation are all mistaken, and are mistaken for childish, ordinary beings.

original: dgra bcom pa ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: An arhat is not one who dreams a dream,

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin zhing /🔽sprul pa'i bar du mthong ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin zhing / sprul pa'i bar du mthong ba ma yin zhing /
translated: nor is he the one who dreams the dream.🔽Up to and including an emanation, he is not one who sees the emanation,

original: sprul pa mthong pa po'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: sprul pa mthong pa po'ang ma yin la /
translated: nor is he the one who sees the one who sees the emanation.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs @99a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs @99a *//
translated: a pratyekabuddha, a bodhisattva, and a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha are not one who dreams a dream,

original: rgyas kyang rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: rgyas kyang rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: nor are they the one who dreams the dream.

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin zhing /🔽sprul pa'i bar du mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin zhing / sprul pa'i bar du mthong ba ma yin /
translated: nor is it the one who dreams the dream,

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to and including the emanator, nor is it the one who sees the emanation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Because all phenomena are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: ma skyes pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unborn and do not exist.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su ma grub pa gang yin pa de dag la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su ma grub pa gang yin pa de dag la /
translated: In those phenomena that are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature and are not fully complete,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: how could bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can nam /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can nam /
translated: have the notion of a thing

original: yongs su grub pa'i 'du shes can du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i 'du shes can du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: or the notion of being fully complete?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig la dngos po'am /
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig la dngos po'am /
translated: If any phenomenon were a thing,

original: yongs su grub pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'am /
translated: were fully complete,

original: yod pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: yod pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: or existed,

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gzugs la chags pa med cing rnam par shes pa'i bar la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gzugs la chags pa med cing rnam par shes pa'i bar la chags pa med do //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom is not attached to form, up to is not attached to consciousness.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la chags pa med do //🔽gzugs kyi khams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la chags pa med do // gzugs kyi khams la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the desire realm.🔽He is not attached to the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan dang; rnam par thar pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang; rnam par thar pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the meditative concentrations, the liberations, and the absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la chags pa med pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la chags pa med pa nas /
translated: He is not attached to the four establishments of mindfulness, up to

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag @99b la chags pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag @99b la chags pa med do //
translated: he is not attached to the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la chags pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, and the wishless meditative stabilization.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do //
translated: In the same way, he is not attached to the perfections of moral discipline, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: he perfects the first level,

original: de la'ang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de la'ang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
translated: but he does not arouse longing desire for it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar des sa de ma dmigs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar des sa de ma dmigs na /
translated: Because he does not apprehend that level.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could he arouse longing desire for it?

original: de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: In the same way, he perfects the tenth level,

original: de la'ang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de la'ang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
translated: but he does not arouse longing desire for it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Because he does not apprehend that level.

original: 'di ltar des sa de ma dmigs na; de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar des sa de ma dmigs na; de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could he arouse longing desire for it?

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod bzhin du /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod bzhin du /
translated: While practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mi dmigs so //
translated: he does not apprehend that perfection of wisdom.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom that is not apprehended,

original: chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i nang du 'dus par mthong la /
analyzed: chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'i nang du 'dus par mthong la /
translated: he sees all phenomena included in that perfection of wisdom.

original: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: But he does not apprehend those phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar chos de dag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because those phenomena and the perfection of wisdom are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar chos de dag la tha dad pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag la tha dad pa ci'ang med de /
translated: it is because those phenomena are not different in any way.

original: chos kyi dbyings @100a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings @100a *//
translated: The realm of phenomena

original: bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not different from all phenomena, because it is taught as the realm of phenomena, and it is taught as suchness and the very limit of reality.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: If all phenomena are indivisible,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
translated: how are virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena taught?

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
translated: How are mundane and supramundane phenomena taught?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
translated: How are contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena taught?

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ji ltar bstan lags /
translated: How are conditioned and unconditioned phenomena taught?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: ci chos rnams kyi chos nyid de la /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: ci chos rnams kyi chos nyid de la / 'dus byas sam /
translated: In the intrinsic nature of phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: is there any conditioned or unconditioned phenomenon,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: or any result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: result of non-returner,🔽state of a worthy one,🔽solitary buddha’s awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi chos 'ga' tsam gyi brjod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi chos 'ga' tsam gyi brjod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: or awakening of a buddha?”🔽“

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, for that reason, you should understand that all phenomena are not different, that all phenomena are without defining characteristics, are unborn, and do not cease.

original: rab 'byor / nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na @100b gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na @100b gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, when I was previously practicing bodhisattva conduct, I did not apprehend the intrinsic identity of any phenomenon, from form,🔽feeling,

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba'am / 'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am / 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or consciousness,

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar ram /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar ram /
translated: up to conditioned or unconditioned,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar ram /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar ram /
translated: or from the result of stream enterer,

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du chos 'ga' tsam gyi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du chos 'ga' tsam gyi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: up to awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: be skilled in the nature of all phenomena by way of nonapprehension, up to fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byang chub kyi lam yang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byang chub kyi lam yang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: The bodhisattva great being who is skilled in the nature of all phenomena completes the path to awakening,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: brings beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and takes hold of a buddhafield.

original: de la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la gnas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Dwelling in that, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ci nas sems can rnams btul nas srid pa gsum du kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: ci nas sems can rnams btul nas srid pa gsum du kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'dul bar byed do //
translated: and having disciplined them, he disciplines them in such a way that they will not be defiled by the three worlds.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //🔽shes rab @101a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o // shes rab @101a *//
translated: Subhuti, in this way should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom, by way of the signless.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: mtshan nyid med pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Chapter 72: The Teaching of Signlessness🔽Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,🔽all dharmas are like a dream, non-existent, of the nature of non-existence, empty of their own marks,🔽and yet you want to train in the perfection of wisdom, to stand in the perfection of wisdom, to train in all the perfections, to stand in all the perfections,

original: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la /🔽'di dag ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la / 'di dag ni dge ba'o //
translated: to train in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, to stand in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,🔽to train in the ten powers of a Tathagata, to stand in the ten powers of a Tathagata,

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: to train in the four fearlessnesses, to stand in the four fearlessnesses,🔽to train in the four detailed and thorough knowledges, to stand in the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽to train in the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha, to stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha,🔽to train in the knowledge of all aspects, to stand in the knowledge of all aspects,🔽to train in the knowledge of path aspects, to stand in the knowledge of path aspects,🔽to train in the knowledge of all modes, to stand in the knowledge of all modes,🔽to train in the knowledge of a Pratyekabuddha, to stand in the knowledge of a Pratyekabuddha,🔽to train in the knowledge of a Disciple, to stand in the knowledge of a Disciple,🔽to train in the knowledge of a worldling, to stand in the knowledge of a worldling,🔽and you want to fully awaken to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and then lead across the world with its gods, humans, and titans that has not crossed, free the world with its gods, humans, and titans that has not been freed, and bring to final nirvana the world with its gods, humans, and titans that has not attained final nirvana?

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: These are mundane.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: These are supramundane.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: These are with outflows.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: These are without outflows.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas so //
translated: These are conditioned.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: These are unconditioned.

original: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will manifest the result of stream enterer.

original: 'di dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will manifest the result of once-returner.

original: 'di dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will manifest the result of non-returner.

original: 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will manifest the state of a worthy one.

original: 'di dag ni rang byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang byang chub mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will manifest individual enlightenment.

original: 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o zhes ji ltar bzhag par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o zhes ji ltar bzhag par 'gyur lags /
translated: These will manifest unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“

original: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang / dngos @101b po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang / dngos @101b po ma mchis pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: Likewise, it is like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like an illusion, like a magical creation, like a nonexistent thing, like the nature of a nonexistent thing,🔽

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'gyur bar ji ltar rnam par bzhag par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du 'gyur bar ji ltar rnam par bzhag par 'gyur lags /
translated: Similarly, how could the establishment of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of phenomena that are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, like a phantom, that are non-existent, that are the non-existence of an intrinsic nature, and that are empty of their own characteristics be posited?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having thus been asked, the Lord said to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni rmi lam yang dmigs so //🔽rmi lam rmi ba po'ang dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni rmi lam yang dmigs so // rmi lam rmi ba po'ang dmigs so //
translated: “Su­bhūti, here, foolish, ordinary beings, who are untrained and lack learning, apprehend dreams.🔽They also apprehend the one who dreams.

original: sprul pa'i bar du'ang dmigs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar du'ang dmigs so //
translated: They also apprehend magical creations,

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang dmigs so //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang dmigs so //
translated: and they also apprehend the one who sees the magical creation.

original: de rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam rmi ba po'ang dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: de rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam rmi ba po'ang dmigs pa nas /
translated: He sees dreams and he who dreams.

original: sprul pa'i bar du'ang dmigs la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar du'ang dmigs la /
translated: He sees emanations and he who sees emanations.

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang dmigs pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'ang dmigs pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He creates unwholesome formative predispositions with his body, speech and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He creates wholesome formative predispositions with his body, speech and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He creates meritorious, demeritorious and imperturbable formative predispositions with his body, speech and mind.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: dwells in these two kinds of emptiness, the emptiness of the inconcrete and the emptiness of own-marks.

original: stong pa nyid 'di gnyis la gnas nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di gnyis la gnas nas /
translated: Dwelling in these two kinds of emptiness,

original: sems can rnams la khams gsum pa 'di ni stong ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la khams gsum pa 'di ni stong ngo //
translated: he sees that this triple world is empty.

original: zhes chos ston par byed de @102a *//
analyzed: zhes chos ston par byed de @102a *//
translated: They teach the Dharma like this:

original: 'di la gzugs sam /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs sam /
translated: ‘Here there is no form,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: no feeling, no perception,

original: 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: no volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'am /🔽phung po rnams sam /🔽khams rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am / phung po rnams sam / khams rnams sam /
translated: and no consciousness;🔽no aggregates,🔽no constituents,

original: skye mched rnams med do //
analyzed: skye mched rnams med do //
translated: and no sense fields.

original: 'di dag ni rmi lam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rmi lam mo //
translated: These are dreams,

original: 'di dag ni brag ca'o //🔽'di dag ni mig yor ro //🔽'di dag ni smig rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brag ca'o // 'di dag ni mig yor ro // 'di dag ni smig rgyu'o //
translated: these are echoes,🔽these are optical illusions,🔽these are mirages,

original: 'di dag ni sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sgyu ma'o //
translated: these are magical displays,

original: 'di dag ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sprul pa'o //
translated: and these are conjurations.

original: 'di la phung po dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams med do //🔽'di la ni rmi lam dang / rmi lam rmi ba po dang / brag ca dang / brag ca thos pa po dang / mig yor dang / mig yor mthong ba po dang / smig rgyu dang / smig rgyu mthong ba po dang / sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: 'di la phung po dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams med do // 'di la ni rmi lam dang / rmi lam rmi ba po dang / brag ca dang / brag ca thos pa po dang / mig yor dang / mig yor mthong ba po dang / smig rgyu dang / smig rgyu mthong ba po dang / sgyu ma dang /
translated: Here there are no aggregates, constituents, or sense fields.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba po dang / sprul pa dang / sprul pa mthong pa po med de /
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba po dang / sprul pa dang / sprul pa mthong pa po med de /
translated: Here there is no dream and no one who dreams, no echo and no one who hears an echo, no optical illusion and no one who sees an optical illusion, no mirage and no one who sees a mirage, no magical display and no one who sees a magical display, and no conjuration and no one who sees a conjuration.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na khyed ni phung po rnams med pa la phung por 'du shes par gyur /🔽khams rnams med pa la khams su 'du shes par gyur /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin na khyed ni phung po rnams med pa la phung por 'du shes par gyur / khams rnams med pa la khams su 'du shes par gyur /
translated: If all these phenomena are just non-entities and the nature of non-entities, then you have the perception of the aggregates as aggregates, although they are non-existent.🔽You have the perception of the constituents as constituents, although they are non-existent.

original: skye mched rnams med pa la skye mched du 'du shes par gyur la /
analyzed: skye mched rnams med pa la skye mched du 'du shes par gyur la /
translated: You have the perception of the sense-spheres as sense-spheres, although they are non-existent.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / phyin ci log las skyes pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su zin pa yin na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / phyin ci log las skyes pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su zin pa yin na /
translated: Since all these phenomena arise in dependence, arise from error, and are fully taken up by the ripening of karma,

original: khyed ci'i phyir dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la dngos po'i 'du shes bskyed ces ston par byed de /
analyzed: khyed ci'i phyir dngos po med pa'i chos rnams la dngos po'i 'du shes bskyed ces ston par byed de /
translated: why do you generate the perception of entities with regard to non-entity phenomena?”

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @102b pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @102b pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs la mkhas pas sems can ser sna can gang yin pa de dag ni ser sna las bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas sems can ser sna can gang yin pa de dag ni ser sna las bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: By skillful means, they turn stingy sentient beings away from stinginess and connect them to the perfection of generosity.

original: de dag gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de'ang longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de'ang longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: The generosity that they practice becomes a great source of wealth.

original: des de dag de las bskyod nas tshul khrims la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: des de dag de las bskyod nas tshul khrims la 'god par byed de /
translated: Having turned them away from that, they establish them in moral discipline.

original: de dag gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de'ang mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de'ang mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The moral discipline that they take up becomes a cause for rebirth in the higher realms.

original: de nas bskyod nas kyang ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas bskyod nas kyang ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Having turned them away from that, they connect them to meditative stability.

original: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las bsam gtan gnyis pa /
analyzed: de dag gi ting nge 'dzin kyang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las bsam gtan gnyis pa /
translated: Their meditative stability becomes a cause for rebirth in the world of Brahmā.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bsam gtan gsum pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bsam gtan gsum pa /
translated: Similarly, they connect them to the second meditative concentration, having turned them away from the first meditative concentration.🔽They connect them to the third meditative concentration, having turned them away from the second meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa /
translated: They connect them to the fourth meditative concentration, having turned them away from the third meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med /
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: des sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed /🔽'dzud par byed /
analyzed: des sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed / 'dzud par byed /
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.

original: 'god par byed do //🔽des tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas /
analyzed: 'god par byed do // des tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu de las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas /
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: @103a *// phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed /🔽'dzud par byed /
analyzed: @103a *// phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed / 'dzud par byed /
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do //
translated: He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, which is based on the fourth meditative concentration.🔽He encourages them to enter the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: des snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de dag las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas phung po'i lhag ma med dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed /
analyzed: des snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de dag las kyang rnam grangs du mas bskyod nas phung po'i lhag ma med dpa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'dul bar byed /
translated: It also causes them to enter meditative attainment and to be trained in the dhātu of nirvāṇa without remainder through many categories of meditative attainment and the results of meditative attainment.🔽

original: 'dzud par byed /🔽'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzud par byed / 'god par byed do //
translated: He also causes them to enter and to be established in the nirvana realm that is without remainder of the aggregates, after having shaken them from those meditative states and the results of those meditative states by means of many different kinds of teachings.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: In the same way, he causes them to enter and to be established in the four forms of mindfulness, the four forms of correct abandonment, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the three doors to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of intrepid confidence, the four forms of exact knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag la 'dul bar byed /🔽'dzud par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag la 'dul bar byed / 'dzud par byed /
translated: They discipline them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They introduce them to them.

original: 'god par byed do //🔽des zag pa med pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'god par byed do // des zag pa med pa'i chos /
translated: They establish them in them.🔽“They establish those who seek the result of stream enterer in the result of stream enterer by means of those uncontaminated qualities

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: that are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /🔽thogs pa med pa de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
analyzed: bstan du med pa / thogs pa med pa de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
translated: cannot be shown,🔽and are unimpeded.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @103b la 'god do //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @103b la 'god do //
translated: They establish those who seek the result of once-returner in the result of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'god do //
translated: They establish those who seek the result of non-returner in the result of non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god do //
translated: They establish those who seek the state of a worthy one in the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni rang byang chub la 'god do //
analyzed: rang byang chub don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag ni rang byang chub la 'god do //
translated: They establish those who seek individual enlightenment in individual enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag la ni byang chub kyi lam rjod par byed /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba gang yin pa de dag la ni byang chub kyi lam rjod par byed /
translated: For those who are intent on the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they describe the path to awakening,

original: ston par byed /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
analyzed: ston par byed / yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /
translated: they teach it,🔽they encourage it,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed /
translated: they delight in it,

original: 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do //
translated: and they establish it.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / theg ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so; ;'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa 'di ltar dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / theg ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so; ;'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom, with dharmas whose own-being is not something existent, with dharmas that are the emptiness of what transcends limits, and the emptiness of no beginning and no end, establish in the ten wholesome actions those sentient beings who have not been established in the ten wholesome actions, and similarly, up to establish in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha those sentient beings who have not been established in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?”

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas with outflows.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas without outflows.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the conditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the unconditioned dharmas.’

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam par 'jog par bgyid pa 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab @104a *//
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam par 'jog par bgyid pa 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab @104a *//
translated: This is a marvelous and wonderful Dharma.”

original: 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having been asked this, said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa /
translated: Su­bhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: chos rnam par 'jog par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'jog par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: are the ones who establish the dharmas. This is a marvelous and wonderful Dharma.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos shes na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos shes na ni /
translated: Subhūti, if you knew the bodhisattva great beings’ qualities of marvel and wonder,

original: de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la lan du phan gdags par sla ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la lan du phan gdags par sla ba ma yin la /
translated: then it would not be easy for all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to repay the bodhisattva great beings’ benefit.

original: khyed thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chos dang ldan pas zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
analyzed: khyed thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chos dang ldan pas zil gyis mnan par mi nus so //
translated: And you all would not be able to overpower the bodhisattva great beings with a Dharma argument.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la ma mchis pa de gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la ma mchis pa de gang lags /
translated: what are the bodhisattva great beings’ qualities of marvel and wonder that are not found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ qualities of marvel and wonder are not found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir legs par nyon la rab tu yid la gzung zhig dang / bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir legs par nyon la rab tu yid la gzung zhig dang / bshad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, listen well and very carefully, and retain it in your mind, I will explain it to you.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la @104b gnas shing /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la @104b gnas shing /
translated: abiding in the six perfections arisen from maturation,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song ste /🔽de dag tu sems can gang dag /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song ste / de dag tu sems can gang dag /
translated: having attained the five higher knowledges, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the dhāraṇī gateways, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges, go to the world systems in the ten directions,🔽and in those places,

original: sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: to those beings who are to be benefited by giving, they benefit with giving.

original: gang dag tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni shes rab kyi phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni shes rab kyi phan 'dogs so //
translated: Those who should be helped by morality, those who should be helped by patience, those who should be helped by effort, those who should be helped by meditation, those who should be helped by wisdom, they are helped by wisdom.

original: gang dag bsam gtan dang pos phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gsum pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan bzhi pas phan gdags par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan dang pos phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gnyis pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan gsum pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag bsam gtan bzhi pas phan gdags par bya ba dang /
translated: Those who should be helped by the first meditation, those who should be helped by the second meditation, those who should be helped by the third meditation, those who should be helped by the fourth meditation,

original: gang dag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag 'du shes med /
analyzed: gang dag nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag 'du shes med /
translated: those who should be helped by the sphere of infinite space, those who should be helped by the sphere of infinite consciousness, those who should be helped by the sphere of nothingness, those who should be helped by the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, those who should be helped by the cessation of perception and feeling, they are helped by the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni 'du shes med /
translated: Those who are to be benefited by the meditative attainment of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment have no discernment.🔽

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: Those who are to be helped by the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are helped by the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gang dag byams pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni byams @105a *//🔽pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang dag byams pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la ni byams @105a *// pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: Those who are to be helped by love are helped by love.

original: gang dag snying rjes phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dga' bas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag btang snyoms kyis yan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag snying rjes phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dga' bas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag btang snyoms kyis yan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang /
translated: Those who are to be helped by compassion, those who are to be helped by joy, those who are to be helped by equanimity, those who are to be helped by the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: gang dag yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dbang po lngas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag stobs lngas phan gdags par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag yang dag par spong ba bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag dbang po lngas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag stobs lngas phan gdags par bya ba dang /
translated: those who are to be helped by the four right efforts, those who are to be helped by the four legs of manifestation, those who are to be helped by the five faculties, those who are to be helped by the five powers,

original: gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang /
translated: those who are to be helped by the seven factors of enlightenment, those who are to be helped by the noble eightfold path, those who are to be helped by the concentration on emptiness,

original: gang dag mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la /
analyzed: gang dag mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba dang / gang dag smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la /
translated: those who are to be helped by the concentration on signlessness, and those who are to be helped by the concentration on wishlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: They are helped by the concentration on wishlessness.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sbyin pas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa lags /
