analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ji ltar sbyin pas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa lags /
translated: “How do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom benefit beings through generosity?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @105b tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @105b tu phyin pa la spyod pa / sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽give gifts.

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
translated: To those who want food they give food,

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom /
translated: to those who want drink they give drink,

original: bzhon pa dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / spos dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: bzhon pa dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / spos dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / mi'i yo byad ci'ang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed de /
translated: to those who want vehicles they give vehicles, to those who want flowers they give flowers, to those who want garlands they give garlands, to those who want perfume they give perfume, to those who want incense they give incense, to those who want clothing they give clothing, to those who want bedding they give bedding, to those who want seats they give seats, and to those who want any human necessities they give any human necessities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ji ltar 'bul ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ji ltar 'bul ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as they offer to the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, the arhats, the non-returners, the once-returners, the stream winners, the good and the righteous,

original: mir gyur pa rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mir gyur pa rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: and also to human beings,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa rnams la'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa rnams la'ang de bzhin te /
translated: and also to those in the animal world,

original: thams cad la'ang tha dad du dbye ba med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad la'ang tha dad du dbye ba med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: and to all without making distinctions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: Because he gives gifts without making distinctions, because he has realized that all dharmas are without distinction.

original: tha dad pa med par sbyin pa byin pas tha dad pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par sbyin pa byin pas tha dad pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: And because he gives gifts without making distinctions, he will win the dharma which is without distinction, namely

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags mthong na /
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva sees a living being born in the animal realm,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gi sbyin gnas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /🔽byang chub sems @106a *//
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gi sbyin gnas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na / byang chub sems @106a *//
translated: if he thinks, “The object of my generosity is the perfect Buddha, not a living being born in the animal realm,”

original: dpa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: dpa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: that is not the Dharma of a bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Because a bodhisattva mahāsattva, having given rise to the mind of awakening,

original: de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa la sems can 'di dag la ni bdag gis sbyin pas phan gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa la sems can 'di dag la ni bdag gis sbyin pas phan gdags par bya'o //
translated: having thus set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, does not think, “I must help these living beings with generosity,

original: 'di dag la ni phan gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni phan gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: but I must not help these.

original: zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such thing as “mine.”🔽

original: sbyin pas phan btags pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pas phan btags pa de dag kyang /
translated: Those whom he helps with generosity,

original: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur /
translated: They will be reborn in the great sāla tree-like royal familes,

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: in the great sāla tree-like brahmin families, and in the great sāla tree-like business families.

original: sbyin pas phan btags pa de nyid kyis de dag theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas phan btags pa de nyid kyis de dag theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that very giving of benefit, they will gradually pass into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind, by means of the three vehicles.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la skye bo mang pos gsad par gsol ba btab na /🔽des 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis skye bo mang po de dag la nges par sbyin par bya'i sbyin nam /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la skye bo mang pos gsad par gsol ba btab na / des 'khrug pa med pa'i sems kyis skye bo mang po de dag la nges par sbyin par bya'i sbyin nam /
translated: “If many people ask a bodhisattva great being for his body,

original: mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems gzhan bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: he should give it to them with a mind free of disturbance. He should not give rise to any other thought, such as ‘Should I give it or not?’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; ji ltar skye bo mang po de dag gi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; ji ltar skye bo mang po de dag gi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it so? Because it is for the sake of those many beings that they have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gal te de ltar rtog par byed na ni /🔽sangs rgyas bcom @106b ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang khyod sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog par byed na ni / sangs rgyas bcom @106b ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang khyod sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang /
translated: If they think like that,

original: gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya bar sus ma longs zhes smod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas dang / mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya bar sus ma longs zhes smod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the lord buddhas, the bodhisattvas, the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, the arhats, the learners, and the world with its gods, humans, and asuras will all criticize them, saying, ‘You have not been accepted as the refuge, the support, the protector, and the final ally of all beings.’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, if great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: mir gyur pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mir gyur pa rnams sam /
translated: are not accepted by human beings,

original: mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams kyis yan lag dang nying lag rnams bslangs na sbyin nam /
analyzed: mi ma yin par gyur pa rnams kyis yan lag dang nying lag rnams bslangs na sbyin nam /
translated: If nonhuman spirits should ask for your limbs and minor parts, would you give them away?🔽

original: mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems cig shos bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems cig shos bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: If non-human beings ask for your limbs and minor parts, you should not arouse a second thought of whether to give or not to give.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ngas lus 'dis sems can rnams kyi don bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ngas lus 'dis sems can rnams kyi don bya'o snyam ste /
translated: It is because a bodhisattva great being has thought, “I will benefit sentient beings with this body.”

original: sems can rnams kyi don du bsam bzhin du lus yongs su bzung ba'i phyir te /🔽des 'di ltar gang dag gi phyir bdag gis lus blangs pa de dag gis ma bslangs bzhin du khyer te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du bsam bzhin du lus yongs su bzung ba'i phyir te / des 'di ltar gang dag gi phyir bdag gis lus blangs pa de dag gis ma bslangs bzhin du khyer te /
translated: And it is because he has intentionally taken up a body for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'gro 'dod cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro 'dod cig ces sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: He should arouse the thought, “Those for whose sake I have taken up this body should take it away without asking.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba mthong na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slong ba mthong na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings see a beggar,

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs na su zhig sbyin par byed /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs na su zhig sbyin par byed /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is not apprehended, then who gives?

original: su la sbyin par byed /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed /
translated: To whom is given?

original: ci zhig @107a *//
analyzed: ci zhig @107a *//
translated: What is given?

original: sbyin par byed ces de ltar sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par byed ces de ltar sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the mind in this way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos de dag ni shin tu stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de dag ni shin tu stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those phenomena are utterly empty.

original: stong pa nyid ni su la'ang sbyin par mi byed /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni su la'ang sbyin par mi byed /
translated: Emptiness does not give to anyone,

original: len par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: len par yang mi byed do //
translated: nor does it take from anyone.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di lta ste /🔽nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: should train in this way:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: in inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, and in the same way, connect this with each, up to the emptiness of its own mark.

original: de stong pa nyid de dag la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pas de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rtag tu rgyun mi chad par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de stong pa nyid de dag la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pas de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rtag tu rgyun mi chad par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in those emptinesses, they give gifts, and so their perfection of generosity is constantly and always perfected.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas nang dang phyi'i chos rnams bcad cing gtubs kyang /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas nang dang phyi'i chos rnams bcad cing gtubs kyang /
translated: “When they have perfected the perfection of generosity, they cut and sever the inner and outer dharmas,

original: 'di snyam du su zhig nga la gcod cing gtub par byed snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du su zhig nga la gcod cing gtub par byed snyam du mi sems so //
translated: and they do not think, ‘Who is cutting and severing me?’

original: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na /
translated: “Subhūti, looking down with the eye of an awakened one,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bsam bzhin du sems can dmyal ba chen por song ste /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bsam bzhin du sems can dmyal ba chen por song ste /
translated: I see bodhisattva great beings in the east in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River intentionally going to the great hells,

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas nas /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag zhi bar byas nas /
translated: and after they have pacified the suffering of the hells,

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba @107b pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba @107b pa'i sems can de dag la chos ston te /
translated: Through the three kinds of miracles—the miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading others’ minds, and the miracle of instruction—they teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells.🔽Through the miracle of psychic power they pacify the sufferings of the hells, and through the miracles of reading others’ minds and instruction they teach the Dharma.🔽Those bodhisattvas teach the Dharma with great love,

original: de dag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: de dag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis chos ston par byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag byams pa chen po dang /
translated: great compassion,🔽great joy, and great equanimity.

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos kyang chos ston par byed pa dang / de nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' de dag la sems dang bar gyur nas sems can dmyal ba de dag nas thar bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen pos kyang chos ston par byed pa dang / de nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag byang chub sems dpa' de dag la sems dang bar gyur nas sems can dmyal ba de dag nas thar bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Then, the beings in the hells, their minds filled with faith in those bodhisattvas, are freed from those hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba de dag nas theg pa gsum po dag gi /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba de dag nas theg pa gsum po dag gi /
translated: From those hells, they are reborn in the three vehicles.

original: rim gyis sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: rim gyis sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that those sentient beings are gradually brought to the end of suffering by the three vehicles.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams su'ang de bzhin du sbyar to //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams su'ang de bzhin du sbyar to //
translated: He sees that this is so in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, and lower and upper directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten rnam par bltas na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten rnam par bltas na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: Subhūti, when I look out over the world with my buddha-eye, I see bodhisattva great beings in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, serving the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis dad pa drag pos yid du mi 'ong bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis dad pa drag pos yid du mi 'ong bas ma yin gyi /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings serve the blessed buddhas with intense faith, not with what is unpleasant.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi dga' bas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi dga' bas ma yin gyi /
translated: They serve the blessed buddhas with what is pleasant, not with what is unpleasant.

original: dga' ba dang / ma gus pas ma @108a *//
analyzed: dga' ba dang / ma gus pas ma @108a *//
translated: joy, and lack of respect.🔽

original: yin gyi / gus pas bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: yin gyi / gus pas bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: and with respect, not with disrespect.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang dag bstan pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang dag bstan pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings receive the Dharma that those buddha bhagavāns teach.

original: bzung nas kyang 'chang bar byed do //
analyzed: bzung nas kyang 'chang bar byed do //
translated: Having received it, they keep it.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chud gzon par mi byed pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chud gzon par mi byed pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: Until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they never let it be lost.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du'ang de bzhin no //
translated: They see it in the southern, western, northern, and in the intermediate directions, below and above, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa de dag gi don du bdag nyid kyang yongs
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa de dag gi don du bdag nyid kyang yongs
translated: Subhuti: I, with the eye of a Buddha, surveying the world with my Buddha-eye, see in the ten directions, as many world systems as there are sands of the Ganges, Bodhisattvas, great beings, who, for the sake of beings born as animals, give up their own bodies,🔽and who, after they have given up their bodies,

original: su gtong bar byed do //🔽de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gis yan lag dang nying lag rnams gtubs nas /
analyzed: su gtong bar byed do // de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gis yan lag dang nying lag rnams gtubs nas /
translated: are cut up by the animals,

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams dag tu gtor bar byed /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams dag tu gtor bar byed /
translated: and their limbs and members are scattered in all directions.

original: sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sha rnams zos nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag la byams pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sha rnams zos nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag la byams pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: And those animals, after they have eaten the flesh of those Bodhisattvas, great beings, will be filled with love for those Bodhisattvas,

original: de dag byams pa thob pa des dud 'gro'i skye gnas de nas thar bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag byams pa thob pa des dud 'gro'i skye gnas de nas thar bar 'gyur la /
translated: and through that love they will be delivered from the animal world.

original: thar nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par @108b byed de /
analyzed: thar nas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mnyes par @108b byed de /
translated: Having been freed, they please the Lord Buddhas.

original: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: They serve those Lord Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang nyan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang nyan la /
translated: and from those Lord Buddhas they hear the Dharma.

original: chos de dag mnyan nas de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: chos de dag mnyan nas de bzhin nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: Having heard that Dharma, they practice accordingly.🔽They go forth by means of the three vehicles,

original: de dag theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: de dag theg pa gsum po nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas rim gyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas rim gyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: and the Buddha Vehicle, and they finally pass away in the realm of Nirvana which leaves nothing behind.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed cing /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way Bodhisattva-­Mahāsattvas generate the thought of

original: bskyed nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub la de bzhin du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'ang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de dag ni gces spras byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyed nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sgrub la de bzhin du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'ang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de dag ni gces spras byed pa yin no //
translated: and having generated them, they establish them in suchness, and likewise they will pass into parinirvāṇa in the dhātu without remainder of aggregates.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sems can yi dvags kyi yul na 'khod pa rnams kyi yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal🔽rnams sel bar byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sems can yi dvags kyi yul na 'khod pa rnams kyi yi dvags kyi sdug bsngal rnams sel bar byed de /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, when I look with the eye of a buddha, I see bodhisattva great beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the realms of hungry ghosts, dispelling the suffering of hungry ghosts.

original: ser sna spong ba'i phyir yang chos ston la /
analyzed: ser sna spong ba'i phyir yang chos ston la /
translated: They teach the Dharma so that they will abandon stinginess.

original: de nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de nas de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la byams pa'i sems skyed par byed de /
translated: Then they generate a loving mind toward those bodhisattva great beings.

original: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des yi dvags kyi skye gnas nas thar bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des yi dvags kyi skye gnas nas thar bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through that root of virtue, they will be freed from the birthplace of hungry ghosts.

original: thar nas kyang phung po'i lhag @109a *//
analyzed: thar nas kyang phung po'i lhag @109a *//
translated: After being released from there, they will be reborn as animals.🔽

original: ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dag mthong ngo //
translated: and after being released, they will not be separated from the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, until they have attained final nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen po la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen po la gnas pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, in this way, Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who abide in great compassion

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are like this:

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: they abide for the sake of all sentient beings in order to bring about their complete nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams la chos ston pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when I look with my Buddha-eye, I see Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas teaching the Dharma to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm, the gods of the Yāma realm,

original: dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la chos ston te /
translated: and the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: lha'i bu de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las chos thos nas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag las chos thos nas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those gods, having heard the Dharma from those bodhisattva great beings, gradually attain final nirvāṇa through the three vehicles, and will attain final nirvāṇa and will attain final nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor / de na lha'i bu gang dag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rgyas pa de dag gis lhag par mos pa de dag gi gzhal med khang 'bar bar byas nas grogs po dag 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de na lha'i bu gang dag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rgyas pa de dag gis lhag par mos pa de dag gi gzhal med khang 'bar bar byas nas grogs po dag 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: Subhūti, there you see those gods who are intent on the five sorts of sense objects burning up their divine palaces, and teaching the Dharma, saying, ‘Friends, all compounded things are impermanent.

original: su zhig 'du byed rnams @109b la yid rton cing 'dug ces chos ston pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: su zhig 'du byed rnams @109b la yid rton cing 'dug ces chos ston pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: Who would trust in compounded things and stay? ’

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na su dag bram ze'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pa de dag la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na su dag bram ze'i lta ba la mngon par zhen pa de dag la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when I look with the eye of a Buddha, I see that in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, some bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are attached to the view of a Brahmin.

original: kye grogs po dag chos thams cad stong pa la ji ltar lta ba bskyed /
analyzed: kye grogs po dag chos thams cad stong pa la ji ltar lta ba bskyed /
translated: I say to them, 'O friends, how can you generate a view toward all phenomena that are empty?

original: chos thams cad gsob dang / gsog yin pa la ji ltar lta ba bskyed ces lta ba de dag las 'byed pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad gsob dang / gsog yin pa la ji ltar lta ba bskyed ces lta ba de dag las 'byed pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: How can you generate a view toward all phenomena that are false and hollow?' I see that they are separated from those views.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen po la gnas nas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen po la gnas nas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, having stood in great compassion, teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the amazing and marvelous Dharma of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gis mi rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par bltas na shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gis mi rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sdud par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, when I look with my Buddha-eye at the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, I see Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who gather humans through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sdud par byed do //
translated: They gather through generosity, through kind words, through purposeful behavior, and through practicing what one preaches.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud par byed ce na /
translated: Subhūti, how do Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas gather beings through generosity?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar zang zing gi sbyin pa @110a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar zang zing gi sbyin pa @110a *//
translated: Subhūti, here Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas gather beings through two kinds of generosity:

original: dang / chos kyi sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
analyzed: dang / chos kyi sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sems can rnams sdud par byed do //
translated: through the generosity of material things and through the generosity of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pas ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pas ji ltar sems can rnams sdud ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings attract beings by means of generosity?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gser ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gser ram /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings give gold,🔽silver,🔽gems,

original: dngul lam / nor bu'am /
analyzed: dngul lam / nor bu'am /
translated: pearls,🔽cat’s eyes,

original: mu tig gam /🔽bee d'urya'am / dung ngam /
analyzed: mu tig gam / bee d'urya'am / dung ngam /
translated: crystals,

original: man shel lam /🔽byu ru'am / zas sam /
analyzed: man shel lam / byu ru'am / zas sam /
translated: coral,🔽food and drink,

original: skom mam / gos sam /
analyzed: skom mam / gos sam /
translated: clothes,🔽vehicles,

original: bzhon pa'am / mal cha'am /
analyzed: bzhon pa'am / mal cha'am /
translated: beds,🔽seats,

original: stan nam / spos sam /
analyzed: stan nam / spos sam /
translated: incense,

original: me tog phreng ngam /
analyzed: me tog phreng ngam /
translated: flower garlands,🔽lamps,

original: mar me'am / skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mar me'am / skyes pa'am /
translated: men,

original: bud med dam /🔽rta'am / ba lang ngam /
analyzed: bud med dam / rta'am / ba lang ngam /
translated: women,🔽horses,🔽cows,

original: glang po che'am /🔽bdag gi sha sbyin par byed pa na /
analyzed: glang po che'am / bdag gi sha sbyin par byed pa na /
translated: elephants,🔽and even their own flesh.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: When they give, they proclaim:

original: kye mi dag tshur shog /
analyzed: kye mi dag tshur shog /
translated: ‘Hey, people, come here!

original: khyed ci 'dod pa bzhin du khyed nyid kyi dang 'dra bar bsam pa bzang pos dogs pa med par khyer te /
analyzed: khyed ci 'dod pa bzhin du khyed nyid kyi dang 'dra bar bsam pa bzang pos dogs pa med par khyer te /
translated: Take whatever you want, just as you would from your own home, with a good heart and without any hesitation.

original: deng zhig / ces sgra sgrog par byed do //
analyzed: deng zhig / ces sgra sgrog par byed do //
translated: Take it now!’

original: des sbyin pa de byin nas sems can de dag sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: des sbyin pa de byin nas sems can de dag sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro bar byed /
translated: Having given that gift, he causes those sentient beings to go for refuge to the Buddha.

original: chos la skyabs su 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: chos la skyabs su 'gro bar byed /
translated: He causes them to go for refuge to the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bar byed de /
translated: He causes them to go for refuge to the Saṅgha.

original: la la dag ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: la la dag ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: He causes some to take up the five precepts.

original: la la dag ni gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: la la dag ni gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: He causes some to take up the eight branches of the observance of the poṣadha vows.

original: la la dag ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed do //🔽la la dag ni bsam gtan dang po nas @110b 'du shes med /
analyzed: la la dag ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed do // la la dag ni bsam gtan dang po nas @110b 'du shes med /
translated: He causes some to take up the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar du 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: He causes some to take up the first concentration, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: la la dag ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: la la dag ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: He causes some to take up love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: la la dag ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: la la dag ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: Some are connected to the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of giving, the recollection of the gods,🔽and the recollection of the peaceful abodes.

original: la la dag ni lus la so sor rtog pa mi sdug pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa la sbyor ro //🔽la la dag ni rnam par dag pa la /
analyzed: la la dag ni lus la so sor rtog pa mi sdug pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa la sbyor ro // la la dag ni rnam par dag pa la /
translated: Some are connected to the recollection of inhalation and exhalation.

original: la la dag ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la /
analyzed: la la dag ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la /
translated: Some are connected to the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: la la dag ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi la /
analyzed: la la dag ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi la /
translated: Some are connected to the four right efforts.

original: la la dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la /🔽la la dag ni dbang po lnga la /
analyzed: la la dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la / la la dag ni dbang po lnga la /
translated: Some are connected to the four legs of supernatural power.🔽Some are connected to the five faculties.

original: la la dag ni stobs lnga la /
analyzed: la la dag ni stobs lnga la /
translated: Some are connected to the five powers.

original: la la dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la /
analyzed: la la dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la /
translated: Some are connected to the seven factors of awakening.

original: la la dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la /
analyzed: la la dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la /
translated: Some are connected to the noble eightfold path.

original: la la dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la /
analyzed: la la dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la /
translated: and some the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: la la dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad la /
analyzed: la la dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad la /
translated: Some enter the eight liberations,

original: la la dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la /
analyzed: la la dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la /
translated: some the nine serial absorptions,🔽some the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: la la dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la /🔽la la dag ni byams pa chen po la /
analyzed: la la dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la / la la dag ni byams pa chen po la /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽some great love,

original: la la dag ni snying rje chen po la /🔽la la dag ni sangs rgyas @111a *//
analyzed: la la dag ni snying rje chen po la / la la dag ni sangs rgyas @111a *//
translated: some great compassion,

original: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
analyzed: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
translated: some the eighteen unshared qualities of the buddhas,

original: la la dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
analyzed: la la dag ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
translated: some the thirty-two major marks of a great being,

original: la la dag ni dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la /🔽la la dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la /
analyzed: la la dag ni dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la / la la dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la /
translated: some the eighty minor marks,🔽some the result of stream enterer,🔽some the result of once-returner,

original: la la dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la /
analyzed: la la dag ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la /
translated: and some the result of non-returner.

original: la la dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la /
analyzed: la la dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la /
translated: some to the fruit of a non-returner,

original: la la dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la /
analyzed: la la dag ni dgra bcom pa nyid la /
translated: some to the fruit of an arhat,

original: la la dag ni rang byang chub la /
analyzed: la la dag ni rang byang chub la /
translated: some to individual enlightenment,

original: la la dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: la la dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: some to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas zang zing gi sbyin pa byin nas grub pa dang / bde ba rgya chen po la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas zang zing gi sbyin pa byin nas grub pa dang / bde ba rgya chen po la 'god par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, endowed with skillful means, having given a gift of material things, establish them in a great accomplishment and happiness.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos yin no // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, this is the amazing, marvelous Dharma of bodhisattva great beings.

original: sems can rnams la chos kyi sbyin pas ji ltar phan 'dogs she na /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos kyi sbyin pas ji ltar phan 'dogs she na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom benefit beings with the gift of Dharma?

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi sbyin pa ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi sbyin pa ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: Subhūti, there are two kinds of Dharma gifts:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The mundane and the supramundane.

original: rab 'byor / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what is the mundane Dharma gift?

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bstan pa dang / bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching, demonstration, and explanation of mundane dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mi sdug pa bstan pa'i le'u las @111b byung ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang / so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba'i 'jig rten gyi chos gang yang rung ba rnams te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bstan pa'i le'u las @111b byung ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar dag dang / so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba'i 'jig rten gyi chos gang yang rung ba rnams te /
translated: the chapters on the teaching of foulness, the four concentrations, the four divine abodes, up to the formless absorptions, and any mundane dharmas shared in common with ordinary beings.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mundane Dharma gift.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sbyin pa 'di byin nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sbyin pa 'di byin nas /
translated: Subhūti, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, having given this mundane Dharma gift,

original: rnam grangs du mas yang dag par blangs pa de las 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mas yang dag par blangs pa de las 'byed par byed do //
translated: He divides it by means of many explanations.

original: des phye nas thabs la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: des phye nas thabs la mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: Having divided it, he establishes it in the noble dharmas and in the fruits of the noble dharmas, by means of skill in means.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the noble dharmas and the fruits of the noble dharmas?

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the noble dharmas are the thirty-seven factors of awakening and the three gateways to liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag yin no //
translated: The fruits of the noble dharmas are the fruits of the stream-enterer, up to the fruit of arhatship.

original: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa'i bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shes pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid shes pa'i bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shes pa'i bar dang /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the noble dharmas of bodhisattva great beings are the knowledge of the result of stream enterer, up to the knowledge of the state of a worthy one, up to the knowledge of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa'i bar dang / byams pa chen po shes pa dang / snying rje chen po shes pa dang / dga' ba chen po shes pa dang / btang snyoms chen po @112a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu shes pa'i bar dang / byams pa chen po shes pa dang / snying rje chen po shes pa dang / dga' ba chen po shes pa dang / btang snyoms chen po @112a *//
translated: the knowledge of the ten tathāgata powers, up to the knowledge of great love, the knowledge of great compassion, the knowledge of great joy, and the knowledge of great equanimity,

original: shes pa'i bar dang / gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par gang dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: shes pa'i bar dang / gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par gang dag 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang /
translated: and moreover, except for the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, the worldly and the transcendent dharmas, the dharmas with outflows and the dharmas without outflows,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: and the conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the noble dharmas of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the result of the noble dharmas of the bodhisattva great beings?

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The elimination of all the connections with residual impressions is called the result of the noble dharmas of the bodhisattva great beings.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur lags sam /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings gain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will attain the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs par tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs par tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis /
translated: then what is the difference between bodhisattva-mahāsattvas and tathāgatas?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tha dad du bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: @112b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: @112b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: while tathāgatas are called 'those who have attained wisdom.'

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang la gnas nas chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med pa thob pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tha dad par dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med pa thob pa la byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tha dad par dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, based on that, all phenomena are attained without being differentiated, and bodhisattvas and tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas are not observed as different.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa yin te /
translated: Subhuti, this is the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva's worldly Dharma giving.

original: de la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: This, Subhuti, is the Bodhisattva's, the great being's, worldly gift of Dharma, on the basis of which the supramundane gift of Dharma comes about.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la btsud nas thabs mkhas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la btsud nas thabs mkhas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la 'god par byed do //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, having introduced beings to the worldly gift of Dharma, by skill in means establishes them in the knowledge of all modes.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What, Subhuti, is the supramundane gift of Dharma of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which is not common to the common people?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the five faculties,🔽the five powers,🔽the seven branches of enlightenment,🔽the noble eightfold path,🔽the three doors of liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug @113a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug @113a *//
translated: the eight liberations,🔽the nine serial absorptions,🔽the ten universal bases,🔽the eight bases of subjugation,🔽the absence of conflict,

original: pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa bzhi dang /
translated: the knowledge through aspiration,🔽the six superknowledges,🔽and the four thorough purities.

original: dbang bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: dbang bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the three establishments of mindfulness, the three things that need not be guarded against, the five pure groups, the six higher perceptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the three establishments of mindfulness, the nature of never forgetting,

original: bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang /
analyzed: bag chags kyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang /
translated: the elimination of the latent tendencies, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the knowledge of all aspects, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor signs,

original: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams te /
translated: the five hundred dhāraṇī doors, and the meditative stabilization doors.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa /
translated: Those are not worldly.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the gift of the supramundane Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /🔽nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas / nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: With diligence, alertness, and mindfulness, he or she should eliminate worldly covetousness and mental dissatisfaction.🔽With diligence, alertness, and mindfulness, he or she should eliminate worldly covetousness and mental dissatisfaction.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi @113b rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi @113b rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: With diligence, alertness, and mindfulness, he or she should eliminate worldly covetousness and mental dissatisfaction.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la 'byung bar rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la kun 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la 'byung bar rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang / lus la kun 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang /
translated: He or she should be attentive to the arising of the body, attentive to the passing away of the body, and attentive to the arising and passing away of the body.

original: lus la mi gnas par gnas shing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus la mi gnas par gnas shing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med pa dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: not dwelling in the body, and not appropriating anything in the world at all, and the same should be applied to feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yang dag par spong ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the right efforts?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa dang /
translated: They are the generation of will to prevent the arising of evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, the generation of will to abandon evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen, the generation of will to give rise to wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen,

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: and the generation of will to maintain, not lose, increase, and fully perfect wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: rab 'byor / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the bases of supernatural powers?

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //🔽rab 'byor / dbang po @114a *//
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o // rab 'byor / dbang po @114a *//
translated: the basis of supernatural powers that is concentration of investigation accompanied by the formative force of abandonment.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the five faculties?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of vigor, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five faculties.

original: rab 'byor / stobs lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / stobs lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the five powers?

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs te /
translated: They are the power of faith, the power of vigor, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the five powers.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the seven factors of awakening?

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the branch of awakening concerned with right joy,🔽the branch of awakening concerned with right pliancy,🔽the branch of awakening concerned with right meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /🔽de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste / de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: and the branch of awakening concerned with right equanimity.

original: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: Su­bhūti, if you ask what constitutes the noble eightfold path,🔽it comprises right view,🔽right thought,🔽right speech,🔽right action,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right livelihood,🔽right effort,🔽right mindfulness,🔽and right meditative concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang @114b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang @114b zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the noble eightfold path.

original: rab 'byor / de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the three concentrations?

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mchan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mchan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: They are the concentration on emptiness, the concentration on wishlessness, and the concentration on signlessness.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the concentration on emptiness?

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the one-pointed mind that has the aspect of emptiness and the aspect of voidness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration on emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the concentration on wishlessness?

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the one-pointed mind that has the aspect of peace and the aspect of signlessness.

original: de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration on wishlessness.🔽“What is the concentration on signlessness?

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na; mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na; mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pas sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the concentration of wishlessness? It is one-pointedness of mind by way of the aspects of impermanence and suffering.

original: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration of wishlessness.

original: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na; gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na; gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: Subhūti, what are the eight liberations? The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is when one, with the perception of no form internally, sees forms externally.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is when one, having actualized the liberation of beauty with the body, abides in it.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: Having completely transcended all perceptions of form,

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye @115a *//🔽mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye @115a *// mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med /
translated: They think, ‘Space is infinite,’ and they accomplish and abide in the station of the infinity of space.🔽They accomplish and abide in the station of the infinity of consciousness,🔽the station of nothing-at-all,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med /
translated: and the station of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They transcend the station of neither perception nor nonperception,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: and they accomplish and abide in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight deliverances.

original: rab 'byor / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the nine serial absorptions?

original: 'di la kha cig 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: Here, some, secluded from sense desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: secluded from negative and nonvirtuous factors,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with applied thought and sustained thought,🔽with joy and bliss,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / 'du shes med /
