translated: He accomplishes and abides in the first concentration, which is endowed with ideation and scrutiny and is born of seclusion and is accompanied by joy and pleasure born of seclusion.🔽🔽He accomplishes and abides in the second concentration, which is endowed with inner clarity and is accompanied by joy and pleasure born of concentration.🔽

original: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med /🔽'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dag bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med / 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “The first concentration is the attainment and maintenance of the joy and bliss born of seclusion, and likewise the attainment and maintenance of the second, third, and fourth concentrations, and the attainment and maintenance of the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothing whatsoever, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and the attainment and maintenance of the cessation of perception and sensation.

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste; de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste; de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the nine serial absorptions.

original: de la zad par gyi skye mched bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zad par gyi skye mched bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the ten spheres of totality?

original: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / @115b zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par me dang / @115b zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: the base of the totality of earth, the base of the totality of water, the base of the totality of fire, the base of the totality of wind, the base of the totality of blue, the base of the totality of yellow, the base of the totality of red, the base of the totality of white, and the base of the totality of consciousness.🔽

original: zad par nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' ste /
translated: the sphere of the totality of earth, the sphere of the totality of water, the sphere of the totality of fire, the sphere of the totality of air, the sphere of the totality of blue, the sphere of the totality of yellow, the sphere of the totality of red, the sphere of the totality of white, the sphere of the totality of space,🔽and the sphere of the totality of consciousness.

original: de dag ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the ten spheres of totality.

original: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight spheres of mastery?

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing /🔽gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing / gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: Having the notion of internal form, one sees external forms, small, beautiful and ugly,

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: and having mastered them, one knows and sees them.

original: de lta bu 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This is the first sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen por gyur pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen por gyur pa kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes /
translated: “With the perception of the absence of form internally, they see external forms that are large, beautiful, and ugly.

original: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: They see those forms after overcoming them.

original: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //🔽nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po /🔽sngon po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o // nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po / sngon po lta bur ston pa /
translated: This is the second range of mastery.🔽“With the perception of the absence of form internally, they see external forms that are blue,🔽of blue color,

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: of blue luster.🔽For example,

original: dper na / zar ma'i me tog gam /
analyzed: dper na / zar ma'i me tog gam /
translated: it is like the flax flower or

original: yul w'a ra n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po /
analyzed: yul w'a ra n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po /
translated: Benares cloth, which is blue,

original: kha dog sngon po /🔽sngon po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po / sngon po lta bur ston pa /
translated: of blue color,🔽of blue luster.

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du /🔽nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas /
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du / nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas /
translated: In the same way,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po /
translated: with the perception of the absence of form internally,🔽they see external forms that are blue,

original: kha dog sngon po /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po /
translated: of blue color,🔽of blue luster.

original: @116a *// sngon po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: @116a *// sngon po lta bur ston pa /
translated: It is like blue,

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
translated: and it is seen as blue light. This is the third overpoweringly dominant field.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po /
translated: “With the perception of no form internally, one sees external forms that are yellow,

original: kha dog ser po /🔽ser po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog ser po / ser po lta bur ston pa /
translated: have a yellow color,🔽are yellow in appearance,

original: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /🔽dper na / dong ga'i me tog gam /
analyzed: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste / dper na / dong ga'i me tog gam /
translated: and emit yellow light.🔽For example, it is like the flower of the karnikara tree,

original: yul w'a r'a n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po /
analyzed: yul w'a r'a n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po /
translated: or it is like excellent Benares muslin, which is yellow,

original: kha dog ser po /
analyzed: kha dog ser po /
translated: has a yellow color,🔽is yellow in appearance,

original: ser po lta bur ston pa /🔽'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ser po lta bur ston pa / 'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: and emits yellow light.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po /🔽kha dog ser po /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po / kha dog ser po /
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no form internally, one sees external forms that are yellow,🔽have a yellow color,

original: ser po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: ser po lta bur ston pa /
translated: are yellow in appearance,

original: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
translated: and emit yellow light. This is the fourth overpoweringly dominant field.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po /
translated: “With the perception of no form internally, one sees external forms that are red,

original: kha dog dmar po /
analyzed: kha dog dmar po /
translated: have a red color,

original: dmar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: dmar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: They see red forms,

original: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
analyzed: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
translated: red color, and red radiance.

original: dper na / bandu dzi ba'i me tog dang / yul w'a ra n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dmar po /🔽kha dog dmar po /
analyzed: dper na / bandu dzi ba'i me tog dang / yul w'a ra n'a si'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dmar po / kha dog dmar po /
translated: For example, it is like the bandhujīvaka flower, or the excellent cloth from Vārāṇasī, which is red,🔽red color,🔽red radiance,

original: dmar po lta bur ston pa /🔽'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dmar po lta bur ston pa / 'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: and red appearance.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas /
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no form internally,

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po /
translated: they see external forms that are red,🔽red color,

original: kha dog dmar po; dmar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog dmar po; dmar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: red radiance, and red appearance.

original: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth base of overcoming.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs @116b dkar po /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs @116b dkar po /
translated: With the perception of no form internally, they see external forms that are white,

original: kha dog dkar po /🔽dkar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po / dkar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: white color,

original: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
analyzed: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
translated: white radiance, and white appearance.

original: dper na / skar ma pa ba sangs kyi mdog ltar dkar po /
analyzed: dper na / skar ma pa ba sangs kyi mdog ltar dkar po /
translated: For example, it is like the color of the star Pūrvaphalgunā,🔽white,

original: kha dog dkar po /🔽dkar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po /🔽dkar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: white color,🔽white radiance, and white appearance.

original: 'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po /
analyzed: 'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po /
translated: Just as white light appears, so too, with the perception of no inner form, one sees external forms that are white,

original: kha dog dkar po /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po /
translated: white in color,

original: dkar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: dkar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: white in appearance,🔽white in luster.

original: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth sphere of mastery.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “Having completely transcended the perception of form,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: the perception of obstruction having subsided,🔽not attending to the perception of multiplicity, one perceives the space above as infinite.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
translated: Having thus actualized the sphere of infinite space, one remains in it. This is the seventh sphere of mastery.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa ste /
translated: Having the thought, “Infinite consciousness,” he achieves and remains in the station of infinite consciousness. This is the eighth station of mastery.

original: de dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad ces bya'o ////
analyzed: de dag ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad ces bya'o ////
translated: These are called the eight stations of mastery.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: Chapter Twenty-One: The Immeasurables

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of conflict?

original: bsam gtan la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnas pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnas pa /
translated: The bodhisattva great being’s abiding in concentration,

original: @117a *// sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye bar ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @117a *// sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye bar ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: by means of which he achieves the state where the afflictions of other sentient beings and other persons do not arise. This is called the absence of conflict.

original: de la smon nas shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la smon nas shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge through resolve?

original: bsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum gyi shes pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum gyi shes pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva, abiding in concentration, thinks, “I will know this.”

original: shes bya gang dang gang shes par 'dod par gyur pa de la yid kyis smon par byed cing ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de 'grub cing /
analyzed: shes bya gang dang gang shes par 'dod par gyur pa de la yid kyis smon par byed cing ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de 'grub cing /
translated: Whatever they wish to know, they mentally aspire to it and, rising from that concentration, their aspirations are fulfilled.

original: shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni smon nas shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni smon nas shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called knowledge through aspiration because it is the knowledge of any object that one aspires to know by wishing for it mentally, and because it is the accomplishment of that aspiration after rising from that concentration.

original: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six kinds of superknowledge?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /🔽zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ste drug po de dag go /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ste drug po de dag go /
translated: They are the superknowledge of the base of psychic power, the superknowledge of the divine eye, the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of knowing others’ minds, the superknowledge of recollecting former lives, and the superknowledge of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of purity?

original: gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang / mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang / mkhyen pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: They are purity of place, purity of object, purity of mind, and purity of knowledge.

original: bzhi po de dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the ten masteries?

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba @117b dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba @117b dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
translated: They are mastery over life, mastery over mind, mastery over requisites, mastery over action, mastery over birth, mastery over resolve, mastery over aspiration, mastery over miraculous abilities,

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste bcu po de dag go /
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste bcu po de dag go /
translated: mastery over wisdom, and mastery over the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /🔽gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na / gnas la'ang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen cing /
translated: “Su­bhūti, what are the ten powers of the tathāgatas?🔽They are the power of knowledge regarding what is possible and impossible,🔽the power of knowledge regarding one’s own and others’ karmic actions,🔽the power of knowledge regarding the absorptions, the liberations, and entering states of one-pointed concentration,

original: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las rnams dang / las yang dag par blangs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la'ang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i las rnams dang / las yang dag par blangs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang /
translated: the power of knowledge regarding superior and inferior faculties,🔽the power of knowledge regarding the paths that lead everywhere,🔽the power of knowledge regarding recollection of former existences,🔽the power of knowledge regarding death and rebirth,🔽the power of knowledge regarding the termination of the outflows,🔽and the power of knowledge regarding the Dharma that is possessed by the tathāgatas.🔽“Su­bhūti, the four forms of intrepid confidence of the tathāgatas are as follows:

original: rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa khams du ma pa dang / khams sna tshogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sems can gzhan dag dang /
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa khams du ma pa dang / khams sna tshogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sems can gzhan dag dang /
translated: He knows the world’s various and manifold elements just as they are.🔽He knows the various and manifold aspirations of other beings and individuals just as they are.

original: gang zag gzhan rnams kyi 'dun pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan rnams kyi 'dun pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'i shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang /
translated: He knows the faculties of other beings and individuals, their higher and lower faculties, just as they are.🔽He knows the path that leads everywhere just as it is.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: He knows the afflictions of the meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and absorptions, and their purification just as they are.

original: ldang ba thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi @118a *//
analyzed: ldang ba thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / sngon gyi @118a *//
translated: He knows all the ways of rising correctly and as they are.

original: gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
analyzed: gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
translated: He remembers his many former abodes.

original: des tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: des tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: He remembers one lifetime, and so on up to:🔽he remembers his many former abodes with their aspects and locations.

original: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma'i bar dag kyang rnam pa dang bcas yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran pa dang / lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang gzigs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma'i bar dag kyang rnam pa dang bcas yul phyogs dang bcas par rjes su dran pa dang / lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang gzigs te /
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings dying and being born, and he sees how they go to good or bad rebirths according to their deeds.

original: sems can gang dag gi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gi lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He sees beings who are bad in body, speech, and mind, who abuse the noble ones,

original: log par lta ba /
analyzed: log par lta ba /
translated: who have wrong views and act accordingly,

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dag rgyu de dang rkyan des lus zhig ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dag rgyu de dang rkyan des lus zhig ste /
translated: and who, because of that cause and condition, are reborn in a bad realm, in hell.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu skye ba dang / sems can gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa yang dag par lta ba /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu skye ba dang / sems can gang dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa yang dag par lta ba /
translated: He also sees those sentient beings who, with their body, speech, and mind, engage in good conduct, who have the correct view,

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa dag rgyu des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i nang du skye ba dag kyang gzigs la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa dag rgyu des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i nang du skye ba dag kyang gzigs la /
translated: who do not denigrate the noble ones, and who, due to that cause, after the body’s disintegration, are born in the happy realms, in the heavens.

original: des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas /
analyzed: des lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas /
translated: With his pure divine eye, which surpasses the human,

original: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dag tu lus ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba dag kyang /
analyzed: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dag tu lus ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba dag kyang /
translated: he sees sentient beings passing away and being born, with good complexions and bad complexions, in good destinies and in bad destinies, and how they go to the good or evil destinies in accordance with their karma.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / zag pa rnams zad pa dang / zag pa med cing sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta @118b ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa dang / zag pa rnams zad pa dang / zag pa med cing sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dag kyang yang dag pa ji lta @118b ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
translated: the correct understanding of the extinction of the outflows, and the correct understanding of the liberation of mind and liberation through wisdom that is free from the outflows.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what are the tathāgatas’ four forms of fearlessness?

original: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na /
translated: I declare, ‘I am perfect and complete buddha.

original: kye ma de la chos 'di rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: kye ma de la chos 'di rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun par 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: “I do not see any reason to think that anyone in the world, with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas, in this society with its monks and brahmins, could reasonably challenge me, saying, ‘You have not awakened to perfect buddhahood.’

original: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob cing bag tsha ba med pa thob la /
analyzed: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob cing bag tsha ba med pa thob la /
translated: Since I do not see any reason to think that, I have attained happiness, attained fearlessness,

original: mi 'jigs pa thob ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob ste /
translated: and attained self-confidence.

original: gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //🔽'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go /
analyzed: gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o // 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go /
translated: I live as the chief of sages,🔽I roar the lion’s roar in the assembly,🔽and I set in motion the wheel that has not been set in motion by anyone else, a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with virtue,

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: a wheel that is endowed with the Dharma,🔽a wheel

original: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du bskor mi nus pa bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du bskor mi nus pa bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: nga zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na /
analyzed: nga zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na /
translated: If I claim that I have exhausted the defilements,🔽you cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that I have not exhausted these defilements.🔽You cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that even if I practice what I have taught as factors that are obstacles, they will not become obstacles.🔽You cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that even if I practice what I have taught as factors that are obstacles, they will not become obstacles.

original: de la khyod kyis zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba med pa dang / ngas gang dag bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba med pa dang /🔽ngas gang sdug @119a *//🔽bsngal yang dag par zad par byed pa /
analyzed: de la khyod kyis zag pa 'di dag ma zad do zhes chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba med pa dang / ngas gang dag bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes chos dang mthun par bdag la rgol ba med pa dang /🔽ngas gang sdug @119a *//🔽bsngal yang dag par zad par byed pa /
translated: You cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that even if I practice what I have taught as factors that are obstacles, they will not become obstacles.🔽You cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that even if I practice what I have taught as factors that are obstacles, they will not become obstacles.🔽You cannot oppose me by saying in accordance with the Dharma that even if I practice what I have taught as factors that are obstacles, they will not become obstacles.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i lam du gsungs pa de bsten kyang sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs ba dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun pa 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i lam du gsungs pa de bsten kyang sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs ba dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu'i 'jig rten na chos dang mthun pa 'ga' zhig bdag la rgol lo snyam pa'i rgyu de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: I do not see any reason for that, whether in the world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā, or in this community of monks or wanderers, that anyone could reasonably challenge me, saying, ‘If you practice this path, you will not completely end suffering.’

original: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob cing /
analyzed: rgyu de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bde ba thob cing /
translated: Because I do not see any reason for that, I have attained security,

original: bag tsha ba med pa thob la mi 'jigs pa thob ste /
analyzed: bag tsha ba med pa thob la mi 'jigs pa thob ste /
translated: I have attained fearlessness,

original: gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
analyzed: gnas kyis khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o //
translated: and I claim the bull’s place, the place of the chief, the foremost,

original: 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go /🔽tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrag go / tshangs pa'i 'khor lo dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: and I roar my lion’s roar in the assemblies.🔽I set rolling the wheel of Brahmā,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: which cannot be rolled by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone in the world.

original: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: su'ang rung bas chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I will turn the wheel of the Dharma in the world, which no one, whether a monk, a brahmin, a god, a mara, a Brahma, or anyone else, can turn in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de dag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four forms of fearlessness.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: Subhuti, what are the four forms of correct knowledge of the Tathagata?

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag bar rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag bar rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The correct knowledge of meaning, the correct knowledge of dharmas, the correct knowledge of etymological explanations, and the correct knowledge of inspired speech.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: don la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig la dmigs pa dang / spobs pa la dmigs @119b pa dag go /
analyzed: don la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig la dmigs pa dang / spobs pa la dmigs @119b pa dag go /
translated: They are the correct knowledge of meaning, the correct knowledge of dharmas, the correct knowledge of etymological explanations, and the correct knowledge of inspired speech.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsrung ba med pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: Subhuti, what are the three forms of fearlessness of the Tathagata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
translated: The Tathagata has completely purified his physical conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Since the Tathagata has no impure physical behavior, he has no thought of concealment, thinking, “May others not know this.”

original: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fearlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gsung gi spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gsung gi spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
translated: The Tathagata has pure verbal behavior.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsung gi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Since the Tathagata has no impure verbal behavior, he has no thought of concealment, thinking, “May others not know this.”

original: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second fearlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag ste /
translated: The Tathagata has pure mental behavior.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs kyi spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' bas gzhan dag gis ma shes na ci ma rung zhes gang bcab par dgongs pa de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Since the Tathāgata has no impure mental activity, he has no thought to conceal anything, thinking, “May others not know this about me.”

original: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsrung ba med pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third fearlessness.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three establishments of mindfulness of the Tathāgata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe kha cig rna blags te gus par nyan cing bka' nyan par sems nye bar 'jog la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa'i tshe kha cig rna blags te gus par nyan cing bka' nyan par sems nye bar 'jog la /
translated: When the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma, some listen with ears perked up, respectfully listen, and apply their minds to receiving the teachings.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
translated: Even if they practice the Dharma in accordance with the teachings, that does not delight the Tathāgata,

original: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: does not please him,

original: thugs yeng yeng por mi @120a *//
analyzed: thugs yeng yeng por mi @120a *//
translated: and does not distract his mind.

original: 'gyur te / 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'gyur te / 'di ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first establishment of mindfulness.

original: kha cig rna mi blag /
analyzed: kha cig rna mi blag /
translated: Some do not perk up their ears,

original: gus par mi nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar mi 'jog la /
analyzed: gus par mi nyan cing bka' nyan pa'i sems nye bar mi 'jog la /
translated: do not listen respectfully, and do not apply their minds to receiving the teachings.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan mi byed na'ang des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
translated: Even if they do not practice the Dharma in accordance with the teachings, the Tathagata will not be upset by that,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: he will not be intolerant.
